title: Full time / Operations Data Analyst (Remote)
description: We are seeking a talented and experienced Systems Business Analyst to join our innovative team. This is a unique opportunity for a tech-savvy professional who is passionate about driving business success through technology solutions. As a Systems Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in analyzing business processes, identifying system requirements, and implementing efficient and effective solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business objectives, processes, and requirements.</li><li>Conduct thorough analysis of existing systems, processes, and workflows to identify areas for improvement.</li><li>Gather and document business requirements, user stories, and use cases.</li><li>Translate business needs into technical specifications for system development and implementation.</li><li>Work closely with software developers, architects, and other stakeholders to design and develop robust system solutions.</li><li>Perform system testing, including developing test plans, executing test cases, and documenting results.</li><li>Conduct post-implementation reviews to evaluate system performance and user satisfaction.</li><li>Provide training and support to end-users on new systems and processes.</li><li>Continuously monitor system performance, identify issues, and propose enhancements or fixes.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.</li><li>Proven experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in systems analysis and implementation.</li><li>Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex business needs into clear and concise technical requirements.</li><li>Proficiency in business analysis tools and methodologies.</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.</li><li>Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on accuracy and quality.</li><li>Solid understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.</li><li>Knowledge of industry best practices and trends in systems analysis and business process improvement.</li><li>Familiarity with database concepts and SQL queries is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.</li><li>Remote work options and flexible schedules.</li><li>Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and innovative solutions.</li><li>Professional development and training programs to enhance your skills.</li><li>Collaborative and inclusive work environment.</li><li>Chance to make a meaningful impact on business processes and drive positive change.</li><li>Health, dental, and vision insurance coverage.</li><li>Retirement savings plan with employer match.</li><li>Generous vacation and paid time off policies.</li><li>Employee recognition and rewards programs.<br></li></ul>Join our dynamic team as a Systems Business Analyst and be part of our mission to optimize business operations and drive growth through technology solutions. Apply now and embark on a fulfilling career in business analysis!

title: Data Engineer
description: 100% Remote<p><br></p>10 Month Contract (W2)<p><br></p><strong><u>Purpose Of The Position</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The HR Data Analyst enables the clients HR to provide world class HR services across key focus areas and meet the strategic objective of "data-driven HR‚Äù; Data Analytics, Insights and HR business intelligence</li><li>The role is crucial in providing an advisory service and guidance to management, and various other stakeholders, regarding HR insights and metrics that is intuitive for business</li><li>The position is responsible for providing data driven insights and analytics across the business to aid effective decision making</li><li>The position will report to the HR Data Analytics Lead and will work closely with HR Data Governance, Reporting &amp; Analytics team and other HR Operations teams, across the broader HR function and directly with the business</li><li>The following job description is intended to describe the general nature of the job that may include other duties as assumed or assigned; it is not intended to be all-inclusive or limit of the duties of the position.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Core Tasks, Responsibilities And Authority</u></strong><p><br></p>Key Accountabilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Accountable for gathering requirements for analytics and insights from business users, designing the data models and visualizations, documenting functional specifications, and working with support vendor teams and creating insight driven dashboards and analytics</li><li>Research and recommend key performance indicators to help identify business opportunities and take insight driven global actions</li><li>Accountable for projects and analyses around HR insights and metrics (e.g., employee demographics, turnover trends, performance and potential, other internal and external benchmarks)</li><li>Provide HR Reporting, Analytics, Insights, Workforce Trends, Automation and recommendations for HR and business groups</li><li>Deliver predictive modeling, machine learning and business process automation using best of breed predictive analytics and AI platforms</li><li>Deliver Business Intelligence to drive actionable business decisions to executive leadership drawing from multiple systems such as core HR master data, talent modules, learning, payroll, time and other global HR data sources</li><li>Create and generate ongoing metric dashboards and detailed reports that include relevant analysis and insights</li><li>Accountable for partnering with Information Systems team and HR Operations Service Delivery Teams, to ensure any amendments to requirements / processes are delivered</li><li>Promote overall data quality and assist in managing the company's HR data; collaborate within HR Operations team to report issues and take through to resolution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Key Deliverables</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>With limited direction, conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis on People data and proactively come up with recommendations for visualizations that are relevant and meaningful</li><li> Provide reporting and analytics to business leaders, HR business partners, line managers and the broader HR function to support decision making</li><li>Work with business owners and internal leads to identify opportunities for process and/or data improvements</li><li>Continuously look for opportunities to improve existing analytics and apply best practices and industry standards</li><li>Intermediate to Advanced HR analytics skills within a global business environment, requirement gathering and analysis, insights, workforce trends, data interpretation and dashboarding</li><li>Minimum of 6 months experience working on SAP Embedded People Analytics Stories functionality</li><li>Expertise in developing data models and visualizations to support the needs of a global HR organization</li><li>Experience with assessing business objectives, conducting gap analysis of existing vs. needed capability and identifying business requirements</li><li>Knowledge of HR metrics and their applicability, and experience with designing user-friendly, intuitive and interactive data visualizations</li><li>Strong desire to learn tools and techniques required to perform tasks like building data pipelines, data visualization, dashboarding, and report writing</li><li>Familiar with HR data and processes and understanding of employee lifecycle</li><li>Efficient at communicating and coordinating initiatives across functional and technical boundaries</li><li>Experience in delivering predictive analytics (such as Pecan AI) or similar platforms</li><li>Knowledge of Churn processes and principles to develop a preventive/predictive model</li><li>Working knowledge of SuccessFactors core and talent modules, learning management, NGA and Kronos applications</li><li>Experience with SAP People Analytics and/or experience in B4 SAP Analytics on Cloud</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Ways Of Working</u></strong><p><br></p>√¢¬ó? Working in a global virtual team<p><br></p>√¢¬ó? Work supportively and collaboratively with other teams<p><br></p>√¢¬ó? Build relationships and trust with key stakeholders<p><br></p>√¢¬ó? Seek opportunities to grow services provided by HR Operations<p><br></p>√¢¬ó? Strive for consistency in the provision of services provided by HR Operations<p><br></p>√¢¬ó? Encourage a growth mind-set across HR Operations to develop greater depth of capability<p><br></p>#ZR

title: HR Data Analyst Expert
description: <strong><u>Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>NFP‚Äôs North American Construction &amp; Infrastructure Group (C&amp;I) is seeking candidates for the role of Strategy &amp; Insights Analyst. In this role the candidate will interact with the C&amp;I Co-Practice leaders on a day-to-day basis, with a particular focus on project management, sales enablement, content creation and executing against strategic initiatives.<p><br></p>Based on assignment, the candidate will analyze variety of qualitative and quantitative data and develop plans that determine the direction the C&amp;I team can take to actualize its goals. They gather, review, and transform data and apply many measures to provide solutions and insights to critical business issues and decisions.<p><br></p>Critical skills in this role include Microsoft office suite with a particular focus on Excel, PowerPoint and Teams. PowerBI also a plus<p><br></p>Business Development/ Sales Enablement<p><br></p><ul><li>Research industry trends in support curation of content and thought leadership </li><li>Organize and maintain master pitch deck content (stored in Teams). Regularly update and collate new content ‚Äì cull dated content</li><li>Undertake macroeconomic and industry market analysis and provide synthesized update for colleagues to support sales process (quarterly)</li><li>Presentation (.PPT) curation &amp; support for Co-Practice Leaders including design of charts, graphs and other visual concepts. (client pitches, speaking engagements etc.)</li><li>Design and develop salesforce dashboard for C&amp;I in tandem with operations teams</li><li>Manage quality control of C&amp;I opportunities in salesforce (identify missing opportunities and enter accordingly, update opportunities moved through funnel etc.)</li><li>For individual client pursuits support execution of RFPs and visualization of key customer data (claims, premiums etc.) via Power BI</li></ul><p><br></p>Insights &amp; Analytics<p><br></p><ul><li>Collect, analyze and make recommendations based on collating various data streams including construction project account information, claims etc</li><li>Support visualization of data analysis whether in excel, powerpoint or other visualization methods (PowerBI and others TBD)</li><li>Ascertain in consultation with construction Operations Leader benchmarking protocol for construction and infrastructure projects</li><li>Manage connectivity with third party construction and infrastructure data sources which may include and are not limited to Dodge Data, Global Data, IBIS World, Capital IQ, Infralogic etc</li></ul><p><br></p>Special Projects<p><br></p><ul><li>Support analytics and operations leaders of C&amp;I practice in performing quantitative analysis for business case development around special projects including but not limited to MGAs, insurance products and consulting services</li><li>Be founding member of innovation lab team ‚Äì support organization of hackathon</li><li>Educate colleagues on emerging technologies in construction, infrastructure and insurance and their application for colleagues, clients and prospects</li><li>Manage monthly C&amp;I network call held by C&amp;I leaders - support sourcing of speakers, develop live polls to engage staff, manage call distribution, interface with industry leaders to secure powerpoint content</li><li>Other projects and responsibilities as assigned in support of individual clients or new initiatives</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Key Abilities &amp; Skills (existing Or To Be Developed)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to distill complex concepts and visualize them to ensure effective communication for presentations</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities through various stakeholders</li><li>Problem solving and critical thinking ‚Äì occasional projects will be assigned , the successful candidate is expected to research, analyze and determine on their own accord how to address a specific problem or business challenge</li><li>Personality Traits &amp; Competencies</li><li>Good with numbers</li></ul> <ul><li></li><ul><li>High attention to detail</li><li>Organized</li><li>Logical</li><li>Reliable</li><li>Ability to distill large amounts of information in to key takeaways</li></ul></ul> <ul><li> Program Skills</li><li></li><ul><li>Excel (Critical)</li><li>PowerPoint (Critical)</li><li>Teams (Critical)</li><li>@Risk (a plus)</li><li>PowerBI (a plus)</li><li>EPIC Brokerage Agency System</li><li>Various third party platforms in the risk management sphere including Broadspire RMIS, Origami, Vertafore etc</li></ul></ul>

title: Strategy & Insights Analyst
description: <strong>Location:</strong> Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship &amp; relocation assistance)<br><br>Annual Base Salary range of <strong>$75,000 - $100,000 per annum </strong>+ performance-based bonus - 0% tax environment + an opportunity to join our employee share scheme<br><br><strong>About Cobblestone Energy<br><br></strong>Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.<br><br>We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.<br><br>At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!<br><br><strong>Cobblestone Values<br></strong><ul><li>Lifelong learning with continuous reflection </li><li>Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas </li><li>The team is more important than the individual</li><li>Being the best in any market we enter</li><li>Hiring and keeping only the most effective people </li><li>Others must benefit from our existence. <br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer In This Role<br></strong><ul><li>A full-time position on our Commercial team</li><li>Committed and remarkably talented colleagues. </li><li>Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance </li><li>An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career. </li><li>Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business. </li><li>Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Summary:</strong> We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. With a passion for data-driven solutions and a strong academic background, the successful candidate will play a key role in supporting our business decisions and driving operational efficiencies through the use of advanced analytics and predictive modelling techniques.<br><br><strong>Key Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Analyse large and complex datasets to uncover key insights and inform business decisions. </li><li>Design and implement predictive models to support the optimization of trading strategies and market forecasting. </li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutions</li><li>Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning and apply these to the power trading domain </li><li>Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li>2-3 years of experience in data science or a related field, with a proven track record of success </li><li>Strong academic background in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field </li><li>Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills </li><li>Proficiency in python programming language. </li><li>Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and data visualization tools </li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment. <br><br></li></ul>This is an outstanding opportunity for a driven and talented Data Scientist to join a market-leading power trading company and make a significant impact on our business operations. If you possess a passion for data science and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply.<br><br>Note: While previous work experience in the power trading domain is highly desirable, it is not a requirement for this role.

If you possess a passion for data science and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply.<br><br>Note: While previous work experience in the power trading domain is highly desirable, it is not a requirement for this role.

title: Temporary Business Analytics Assistant
description: <strong>ProSource </strong>is accepting applications for the following position on behalf of our client. If you are interested and feel you meet the qualifications, we would love to hear from you.<p><br></p><strong>Position: </strong>Analytic Engineer.<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong>Remote.<p><br></p><strong>Type: </strong>Contract (3 Month+, 40 hours/week).<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with product owners, and other departments to understand and clarify requirements, and provide direction on solutions and approaches.</li><li>Work closely with data engineers and other analytics engineers to build high-quality, scalable data models.</li><li>Design, develop and deliver ELT, reports, dashboards, and visualizations from high-level business requirements.</li><li>Enable quick decision-making by querying Gravie‚Äôs data warehouse to answer business questions using Amazon Redshift.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years in data/analytics as an engineer or analyst.</li><li>Experience building out data pipelines and orchestrating performant data models on cloud warehouse using DBT and one or more data orchestration tools (Airflow preferred).</li><li>Experience creating reports and dashboards using data visualization Tableau.</li><li>Fluent SQL skills including complex queries which are optimized for performance.</li><li>Experience working with a cloud-based data warehouse, such as Redshift, BigQuery, or Snowflake.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About ProSource.</u></strong><p><br></p>ProSource is a full-service staffing company that conducts nationwide searches on behalf of our clients offering direct hire, contract, and contract-to-hire services. We take your privacy seriously and will not share your personal information with any organization without your prior approval.<p><br></p>Feel free to contact us directly at jobs@askprosource.com or visit www.askprosource.com for additional job opportunities. We look forward to hearing from you!

description: Opportunity to work for a proprietary global market maker, trading on major financial markets around the world. As a member of the Systems Engineering team you‚Äôll be instrumental in an environment of continuous improvement, providing and guaranteeing a stable platform for trading systems.<br><br>Strong industry salary based on experience and interview<br><br>401K w/ match, FULLY paid health insurance, paid commute<br><br>25 days paid vacation<br><ul><li>3+ years of experience with Linux</li><li>Great communication</li><li>Excellent scripting skills, preferably with Python<br></li></ul>

title: Analytic Engineer (GR001c)
description: The Enterprise Cloud Team is looking for a Cloud Engineer with hands-on Microsoft Azure cloud engineering experience and <strong>required Databricks infrastructure, performance, hands-on.</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Details</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is for USA Direct hire only Salary range from $90 K - $115 K</li><li>Must have legally eligible to work in Canada and Visa to travel to USA</li><li>Any immigration attempts are not supported</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The ideal candidate has experience working in hybrid (cloud &amp; on-prem) environments, and multi-cloud if possible, building and maintaining cloud group and subscription hierarchies, building and securing cloud-based infrastructure, supporting application runtime environments, architecting solutions and comfortable collaborating and communicating with engineers at all levels of the datacenter stack to implement complicated architectures and designs, while being hands-on as needed.</li><li>The ideal candidate must be a quick learner of our infrastructure/environment, proactive in taking on tasks and not afraid to assume ownership of the tasks, end-to-end.</li><li>The candidate must be a ‚Äúdo-er" not a follower and must be willing to provide commentary and opinion on just about any cloud-related topic.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage Databricks infrastructure and collaborate with various teams to ensure it integrates seamlessly with all components including network, security, messaging, and remote access. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve Databricks environment performance issues, connectivity issues, security issues. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Experience in setting up ‚ÄúAdmin Group" and give user admin privileges, adding them to admins group using Admin Console, Groups API 2.0, SCIM API 2.0 or using SCIM-enabled identity provider. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Experience as ‚ÄúDatabricks workspace Admin", who manage workspace users and groups including single sign-on, provisioning, access to Databricks SQL, and access control and workspace storage. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Work with Application and Solution Architects, Software Engineers &amp; Infrastructure Engineers to solve technical and operational challenges, drive efficiency and provide critical support for business impacting issues</li><li>Act as a point of escalation regarding Azure and AWS situations for the Cloud Support Team</li><li>Support multiple systems or applications of high complexity, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility</li><li>Act as the technical liaison between operational and development teams, providing critical operational insight to upcoming implementations and strategies, including validation of ongoing solutions supportability</li><li>Stay well-informed of failures and complications related to our cloud offerings</li><li>Be responsible for debugging technical issues inside a complex stack involving virtualization, containers, micro-services, etc.</li><li>Collaborate with engineering teams to enable their applications to migrate to and run on Cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Work with automation team to maintain Automation scripts / tools created to support monitoring and automation of operational support</li><li>Manage and Support cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines.</li><li>Strong implementation and support of APIs to troubleshoot RESTful services and integration of them with consumers</li><li>Extensive experience with open-source technology, software development and system engineering.</li><li>Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems.</li><li>Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, providing associated training as required.</li><li>Lead and develop best practices and runbooks for use by operations and escalations teams</li><li>Stay current with industry trends, contributing to recommendations as needed to help the company excel.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering; Master's degree a plus.</li><li>Certification as an Azure Solutions Architect, Cloud Security Certification, and/or OpenStack</li><li>8+ years of experience in Azure cloud computing and design.</li><li>Experience with popular solutions from the leading cloud vendors, primarily Microsoft Azure, as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting micro-service and server-less design concepts and patterns</li><li>Proven design, planning and implementation experience with all infrastructure components including Storage, Network and Compute technologies</li><li>Experience working with Azure App Service, Azure Policy and Security Center - diagnosing and remediating resource contention issues and Identify failures in application logs</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining Azure Management Group hierarchies, Subscriptions, Resource Groups, employing out-of-the-box and custom Roles and Policies to support ‚Äúminimal privileges" and ‚Äúseparation of responsibilities (SOR)"</li><li>Experience working with Agile methodologies supporting Infrastructure-as-a-service coding and deployment</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting Code/Devops and Data pipelines leveraging code repository tools such as GIT, CI/CD tools such as GitLab CI, image repositories such as Artifactory and Azure DevOps, Azure Data Flow pipelines</li><li>Hands-on experience with infrastructure and configuration management scripting tools and solutions - Hashicorp Terraform (required), Puppet, Chef, Ansible, CF templates, ARM</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting complex cloud security patterns, integrating on-premises and cloud security services, including encryption keys, certificates, PKI, CA, HSM's, key/secrets and Key Management Vault services</li><li>Coding and scripting experience using PowerShell, Python, Linux command-line shells such as Bash, korn, YAML and JSON, Cloud APIs, etc.</li><li>Comfortable coding in a polyglot environment, including Java, C/C++, NodeJS, Perl, Python, Scala, GoLang, .Net CORE</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining complex authentication, authorization and single-sign-on (SSO) and federation patterns, leveraging SAML2, OAuth2/OIDC, IDaaS providers such as Okta, API Gateways, API orchestrations, and JWT's</li><li>Experience debugging complex API orchestrations, synchronous and asynchronous micro-service APIs using infrastructure and application logs</li><li>Excellent understanding of terminology and concepts across popular public cloud services, including the ‚Äúcloud computing stack," i.e., Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS), as well as third-party services including Databricks, Snowflake, ElasticSearch</li><li>Understanding of artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), and experience working with Machine Learning services such as SparkML, pySpark, Scikit, Tensor, GPUs, etc.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Containerization technologies including Azure AKS, Redhat ARO/Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, EKS</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting data analytics platforms (including Data Lakes and Data Hubs) based on Hadoop/Hive/Spark family, Cloudera, HortonWorks, SnowFlake</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting SQL, NoSQL and document databases, including complex queries, PL/SQL</li><li>Experience with implementing and automating on-premise private cloud technologies such as OpenShift, Pivotal and custom Automation tooling</li><li>Ability to interface with and communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.</li><li>Self-motivated and skilled at working in tandem with a team of engineers, or alone as required.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills to assist clients both internal and external and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workspace.</li><li>Time management skills with the ability to manage multiple work streams and lead and mentor less experienced engineers-Strong awareness of networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP and distributed networks.</li><li>Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues with a variety of cloud vendors and services using cloud infrastructure and application logs</li><li>Experience with operating systems such as Linux, Unix &amp; Windows</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About NPO USA</u></strong><p><br></p>If you are smart and curious about new things, we are looking for you: this is an exciting opportunity to work, learn and acquire new skills!

title: Linux Engineer
description: <p>We are looking for people from all over the world to participate in some of our many exciting work-from-home opportunities. These opportunities range from simple surveys that can be completed in less than one hour to ongoing projects that last for months or longer.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>What do we do?</strong></p><p>Appen collects and labels images, text, speech, audio, video, and other data used to build and continuously improve the world‚Äôs most innovative artificial intelligence systems.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Why do we need you?</strong></p><p>We can‚Äôt accomplish our mission without our global network of over 1 million skilled contributors who help us curate reliable training data to help improve AI technology around the world. We need people like you to join our network of contractors and help us make a difference in improving AI technology.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Here are examples of some of the opportunities that may be available:</strong></p><p>‚Ä¢ Search Engine Evaluation (Work with the world‚Äôs top search engine companies)</p><p>‚Ä¢ Social Media Evaluation (Help improve social media around the globe)</p><p>‚Ä¢ Translation</p><p>‚Ä¢ Transcription</p><p>‚Ä¢ Short Surveys (Short projects that last from 15 minutes to three hours)</p><p>‚Ä¢ Data Collection Projects (Voice recording, Image Collection, etc.)</p><p>‚Ä¢ Linguistic Specialties (Text to Speech, Computational, Phonetics, Pronunciation, Annotation, etc.)</p><p> </p><p><br></p><p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p><p>‚Ä¢ Applicants must be self-motivated and internet savvy</p><p>‚Ä¢ No previous work experience or college degree required</p><p>‚Ä¢ Smartphone or Computer</p><p>‚Ä¢ Knows how to navigate the internet and has enough resources to perform the task</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong><span class="ql-cursor"> </span>Benefits:</strong></p><p>‚Ä¢ Earn extra income while at home</p><p>‚Ä¢ Flexible work hours</p><p>‚Ä¢ You can apply to as many projects as you can</p><p>‚Ä¢ You can work on our projects around your other jobs or while studying</p><p>‚Ä¢ Appen is ranked as the top 1 out of 100 companies offering remote jobs by Flexjobs.com</p><p> </p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>Thank you and we hope you can be part of our growing global team!</p><p> </p><p><br></p><p><em>A diverse, inclusive culture is vital to our mission of helping build better AI. We offer opportunities for individuals of all abilities and backgrounds.</em></p><p></p>

title: Azure Databricks Engineer (FT)
description: <strong>Azure Engineer - local to Chicago, or Northern New Jersey, or New York.</strong><p><br></p>The Enterprise Cloud Team is looking for a Cloud Engineer with hands-on Microsoft Azure cloud engineering experience and <strong>required Databricks infrastructure, performance, hands-on.</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Details</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is for USA.</li><li>Candidate must be located either close to Chicago, or Northern New Jersey, or New York city.</li><li>Must be able to visit office at least once a month in corresponding location.</li><li>Direct hire only.</li><li>Salary range from $90 K - $125 K.</li><li>AZ-104 or higher (REQUIRED).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The ideal candidate has experience working in hybrid (cloud &amp; on-prem) environments, and multi-cloud if possible, building and maintaining cloud group and subscription hierarchies, building and securing cloud-based infrastructure, supporting application runtime environments, architecting solutions and comfortable collaborating and communicating with engineers at all levels of the datacenter stack to implement complicated architectures and designs, while being hands-on as needed.</li><li>The ideal candidate must be a quick learner of our infrastructure/environment, proactive in taking on tasks and not afraid to assume ownership of the tasks, end-to-end.</li><li>The candidate must be a ‚Äúdo-er" not a follower and must be willing to provide commentary and opinion on just about any cloud-related topic.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage Databricks infrastructure and collaborate with various teams to ensure it integrates seamlessly with all components including network, security, messaging, and remote access. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Work with Application and Solution Architects, Software Engineers &amp; Infrastructure Engineers to solve technical and operational challenges, drive efficiency and provide critical support for business impacting issues.</li><li>Act as a point of escalation regarding Azure and AWS situations for the Cloud Support Team</li><li>Support multiple systems or applications of high complexity, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility.</li><li>Act as the technical liaison between operational and development teams, providing critical operational insight to upcoming implementations and strategies, including validation of ongoing solutions supportability.</li><li>Stay well-informed of failures and complications related to our cloud offerings.</li><li>Be responsible for debugging technical issues inside a complex stack involving virtualization, containers, micro-services, etc.</li><li>Collaborate with engineering teams to enable their applications to migrate to and run on Cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Work with automation team to maintain Automation scripts / tools created to support monitoring and automation of operational support.</li><li>Manage and Support cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines.</li><li>Strong implementation and support of APIs to troubleshoot RESTful services and integration of them with consumers.</li><li>Extensive experience with open-source technology, software development and system engineering.</li><li>Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems.</li><li>Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, providing associated training as required.</li><li>Lead and develop best practices and runbooks for use by operations and escalations teams</li><li>Stay current with industry trends, contributing to recommendations as needed to help the company excel.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering; Master's degree a plus.</li><li>Certification as an Azure Solutions Architect, Cloud Security Certification, and/or OpenStack.</li><li>8+ years of experience in Azure cloud computing and design.</li><li>Experience with popular solutions from the leading cloud vendors, primarily Microsoft Azure, as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS).</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting micro-service and server-less design concepts and patterns.</li><li>Proven design, planning and implementation experience with all infrastructure components including Storage, Network and Compute technologies.</li><li>Experience working with Azure App Service, Azure Policy and Security Center - diagnosing and remediating resource contention issues and Identify failures in application logs.</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining Azure Management Group hierarchies, Subscriptions, Resource Groups, employing out-of-the-box and custom Roles and Policies to support ‚Äúminimal privileges" and ‚Äúseparation of responsibilities (SOR)."</li><li>Experience working with Agile methodologies supporting Infrastructure-as-a-service coding and deployment.</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting Code/Devops and Data pipelines leveraging code repository tools such as GIT, CI/CD tools such as GitLab CI, image repositories such as Artifactory and Azure DevOps, Azure Data Flow pipelines.</li><li>Hands-on experience with infrastructure and configuration management scripting tools and solutions - Hashicorp Terraform (required), Puppet, Chef, Ansible, CF templates, ARM.</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting complex cloud security patterns, integrating on-premises and cloud security services, including encryption keys, certificates, PKI, CA, HSM's, key/secrets and Key Management Vault services.</li><li>Coding and scripting experience using PowerShell, Python, Linux command-line shells such as Bash, korn, YAML and JSON, Cloud APIs, etc.</li><li>Comfortable coding in a polyglot environment, including Java, C/C++, NodeJS, Perl, Python, Scala, GoLang, .Net CORE.</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining complex authentication, authorization and single-sign-on (SSO) and federation patterns, leveraging SAML2, OAuth2/OIDC, IDaaS providers such as Okta, API Gateways, API orchestrations, and JWT's.</li><li>Experience debugging complex API orchestrations, synchronous and asynchronous micro-service APIs using infrastructure and application logs.</li><li>Excellent understanding of terminology and concepts across popular public cloud services, including the ‚Äúcloud computing stack," i.e., Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS), as well as third-party services including Databricks, Snowflake, ElasticSearch.</li><li>Understanding of artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), and experience working with Machine Learning services such as SparkML, pySpark, Scikit, Tensor, GPUs, etc.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Containerization technologies including Azure AKS, Redhat ARO/Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, EKS.</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting data analytics platforms (including Data Lakes and Data Hubs) based on Hadoop/Hive/Spark family, Cloudera, HortonWorks, SnowFlake.</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting SQL, NoSQL and document databases, including complex queries, PL/SQL.</li><li>Experience with implementing and automating on-premise private cloud technologies such as OpenShift, Pivotal and custom Automation tooling.</li><li>Ability to interface with and communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.</li><li>Self-motivated and skilled at working in tandem with a team of engineers, or alone as required.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills to assist clients both internal and external and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workspace.</li><li>Time management skills with the ability to manage multiple work streams and lead and mentor less experienced engineers-Strong awareness of networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP and distributed networks.</li><li>Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues with a variety of cloud vendors and services using cloud infrastructure and application logs.</li><li>Experience with operating systems such as Linux, Unix &amp; Windows.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About NPO USA</u></strong><p><br></p>If you are smart and curious about new things, we are looking for you: this is an exciting opportunity to work, learn and acquire new skills!

title: Python Developer (W2)
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>The Support Engineer (L1) ensure that IT infrastructure and systems remain operational through identifying, investigating and resolving technical incidents and problems and to restore service to clients by managing incidents to resolution.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br></strong><ul><li> Monitor infrastructure remotely. </li><li> Ensure that the assigned infrastructure at the client site is configured, installed, tested and operational. </li><li> Investigate first line support calls assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems. </li><li> Ensure the efficient and comprehensive resolution of incidents and requests. </li><li> Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary. <br><br></li></ul><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Professional Freelancer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Old National Bank was established in 1834. Today, we are the largest financial services holding company with dual headquarters in Chicago and Evansville, IN. We provide an array of services to our clients which include Community Banking, Investments, and Wealth Management. At Old National, we believe that by helping our team members balance work life with home life, we create a more productive workforce and a stronger company.<br><br>Old National is seeking a Senior Information Security Analyst that will be responsible for working with business units and third-parties to ensure compliance with security laws and regulations affecting Old National (including GLBA, SOX, HIPAA, FFIEC, etc). The Information Security Analyst, Senior will perform risk assessments, control testing to identify issues, and work with team members to mitigate risk and resolve control gaps. The analyst will also maintain policies, standards, and procedures and supports assurance activities related to availability, integrity, and confidentiality of customer, business partner, associate, and business information as requested.<br><br><strong><u>Key Accountabilities<br><br></u></strong><strong> Perform risk assessments to support issue identification, escalation, and risk mitigation <br></strong><ul><li> Facilitate risk assessments and risk management review processes which analyze organizational security control effectiveness and assist team members in the identification and correction of control gaps. </li><li> Offer guidance on Old National‚Äôs information security program when examining impacts of new infrastructure, technologies, processes, or partnerships. Determine which laws and regulations apply and ensure adherence to the required standards for business applications, infrastructure, processes, etc. </li><li> Escalate issues and recommendations to management, using a risk-based approach, for immediate attention as needed <br></li></ul><strong> Maintain information security documentation and ensure security awareness <br></strong><ul><li> Maintain ONB‚Äôs Information Security Policies, Standards, Procedures, security documentation, regulatory documentation, etc. </li><li> Work closely with IT and other business units to ensure ONB‚Äôs Information Security Program is incorporated into their program initiatives and business requirements. </li><li> Act as an information security advocate to management, team members, and business/process owners. </li><li> Develop, publicize, and support education and training initiatives for all team members to raise awareness of information security and risk management issues </li><li> Participate in departmental activities including meetings, updates, planning, and other responsibilities as needed. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Collaborate With Internal And External Stakeholders<br></u></strong><ul><li> Work directly with business units and team members to ensure completion of information security due diligence documentation and testing is performed on a timely basis and develop plans for further improving key controls. </li><li> Assess and respond to information security events and incidents. Assist in the coordination with internal and external parties and assist in evaluation, communication and documentation of issues and incidents </li><li> Assist in the preparation of reporting for presentation to various teams, committees, and organizations. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications And Education Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Technology, related field, or equivalent work experience required </li><li> 8+ years experience in information security or related field. </li><li> Detailed understanding of information security frameworks such as ISO27001 or NIST and industry best practices. </li><li> Involvement in adhering to security laws and regulations affecting financial institutions including, but not limited to, GLBA, SOX, HIPAA, FFIEC, etc. </li><li> Experience in policy, standards, and procedure creation based on selected framework and implementation issues related to regulatory and other requirements. </li><li> Thorough understanding of how to analyze business applications and recommends appropriate security controls. </li><li> Achieved or in pursuit of a globally recognized information security certification such as CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional), CISA (Certified Information Systems Auditor), or equivalent preferred. <br></li></ul><strong> Old National is proud to be an equal opportunity employer focused on fostering an inclusive workplace and committed to hiring a workforce comprised of diverse backgrounds, cultures and thinking styles. <br><br></strong>As such, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>We do not accept resumes from external staffing agencies or independent recruiters for any of our openings unless we have an agreement signed by the Head of Talent Acquisition, SVP, to fill a specific position

infrastructure and application logs.</li><li>Experience with operating systems such as Linux, Unix &amp; Windows.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About NPO USA</u></strong><p><br></p>If you are smart and curious about new things, we are looking for you: this is an exciting opportunity to work, learn and acquire new skills!
description_json: The Enterprise Cloud Team is looking for a Cloud Engineer with hands-on Microsoft Azure cloud engineering experience and <strong>required Databricks infrastructure, performance, hands-on.</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Details</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is for USA. Direct hire only. Salary range from $90 K - $115 K.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The ideal candidate has experience working in hybrid (cloud &amp; on-prem) environments, and multi-cloud if possible, building and maintaining cloud group and subscription hierarchies, building and securing cloud-based infrastructure, supporting application runtime environments, architecting solutions and comfortable collaborating and communicating with engineers at all levels of the datacenter stack to implement complicated architectures and designs, while being hands-on as needed.</li><li>The ideal candidate must be a quick learner of our infrastructure/environment, proactive in taking on tasks and not afraid to assume ownership of the tasks, end-to-end.</li><li>The candidate must be a ‚Äúdo-er" not a follower and must be willing to provide commentary and opinion on just about any cloud-related topic.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage Databricks infrastructure and collaborate with various teams to ensure it integrates seamlessly with all components including network, security, messaging, and remote access. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve Databricks environment performance issues, connectivity issues, security issues. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Experience in setting up ‚ÄúAdmin Group" and give user admin privileges, adding them to admins group using Admin Console, Groups API 2.0, SCIM API 2.0 or using SCIM-enabled identity provider. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Experience as ‚ÄúDatabricks workspace Admin", who manage workspace users and groups including single sign-on, provisioning, access to Databricks SQL, and access control and workspace storage. (REQUIRED).</li><li>Work with Application and Solution Architects, Software Engineers &amp; Infrastructure Engineers to solve technical and operational challenges, drive efficiency and provide critical support for business impacting issues.</li><li>Act as a point of escalation regarding Azure and AWS situations for the Cloud Support Team</li><li>Support multiple systems or applications of high complexity, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility.</li><li>Act as the technical liaison between operational and development teams, providing critical operational insight to upcoming implementations and strategies, including validation of ongoing solutions supportability.</li><li>Stay well-informed of failures and complications related to our cloud offerings.</li><li>Be responsible for debugging technical issues inside a complex stack involving virtualization, containers, micro-services, etc.</li><li>Collaborate with engineering teams to enable their applications to migrate to and run on Cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Work with automation team to maintain Automation scripts / tools created to support monitoring and automation of operational support.</li><li>Manage and Support cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines.</li><li>Strong implementation and support of APIs to troubleshoot RESTful services and integration of them with consumers.</li><li>Extensive experience with open-source technology, software development and system engineering.</li><li>Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems.</li><li>Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, providing associated training as required.</li><li>Lead and develop best practices and runbooks for use by operations and escalations teams</li><li>Stay current with industry trends, contributing to recommendations as needed to help the company excel.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering; Master's degree a plus.</li><li>Certification as an Azure Solutions Architect, Cloud Security Certification, and/or OpenStack.</li><li>8+ years of experience in Azure cloud computing and design.</li><li>Experience with popular solutions from the leading cloud vendors, primarily Microsoft Azure, as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS).</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting micro-service and server-less design concepts and patterns.</li><li>Proven design, planning and implementation experience with all infrastructure components including Storage, Network and Compute technologies.</li><li>Experience working with Azure App Service, Azure Policy and Security Center - diagnosing and remediating resource contention issues and Identify failures in application logs.</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining Azure Management Group hierarchies, Subscriptions, Resource Groups, employing out-of-the-box and custom Roles and Policies to support ‚Äúminimal privileges" and ‚Äúseparation of responsibilities (SOR)."</li><li>Experience working with Agile methodologies supporting Infrastructure-as-a-service coding and deployment.</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting Code/Devops and Data pipelines leveraging code repository tools such as GIT, CI/CD tools such as GitLab CI, image repositories such as Artifactory and Azure DevOps, Azure Data Flow pipelines.</li><li>Hands-on experience with infrastructure and configuration management scripting tools and solutions - Hashicorp Terraform (required), Puppet, Chef, Ansible, CF templates, ARM.</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting complex cloud security patterns, integrating on-premises and cloud security services, including encryption keys, certificates, PKI, CA, HSM's, key/secrets and Key Management Vault services.</li><li>Coding and scripting experience using PowerShell, Python, Linux command-line shells such as Bash, korn, YAML and JSON, Cloud APIs, etc.</li><li>Comfortable coding in a polyglot environment, including Java, C/C++, NodeJS, Perl, Python, Scala, GoLang, .Net CORE.</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining complex authentication, authorization and single-sign-on (SSO) and federation patterns, leveraging SAML2, OAuth2/OIDC, IDaaS providers such as Okta, API Gateways, API orchestrations, and JWT's.</li><li>Experience debugging complex API orchestrations, synchronous and asynchronous micro-service APIs using infrastructure and application logs.</li><li>Excellent understanding of terminology and concepts across popular public cloud services, including the ‚Äúcloud computing stack," i.e., Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS), as well as third-party services including Databricks, Snowflake, ElasticSearch.</li><li>Understanding of artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), and experience working with Machine Learning services such as SparkML, pySpark, Scikit, Tensor, GPUs, etc.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Containerization technologies including Azure AKS, Redhat ARO/Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, EKS.</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting data analytics platforms (including Data Lakes and Data Hubs) based on Hadoop/Hive/Spark family, Cloudera, HortonWorks, SnowFlake.</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting SQL, NoSQL and document databases, including complex queries, PL/SQL.</li><li>Experience with implementing and automating on-premise private cloud technologies such as OpenShift, Pivotal and custom Automation tooling.</li><li>Ability to interface with and communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.</li><li>Self-motivated and skilled at working in tandem with a team of engineers, or alone as required.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills to assist clients both internal and external and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workspace.</li><li>Time management skills with the ability to manage multiple work streams and lead and mentor less experienced engineers-Strong awareness of networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP and distributed networks.</li><li>Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues with a variety of cloud vendors and services using cloud infrastructure and application logs.</li><li>Experience with operating systems such as Linux, Unix &amp; Windows.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About NPO USA</u></strong><p><br></p>If you are smart and curious about new things, we are looking for you: this is an exciting opportunity to work, learn and acquire new skills!

title: MS Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you‚Äôll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it ‚Äî we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here‚Äôs what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors ‚Äì Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years ‚Äì (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Golang programing language</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Linux administration/scripting skillset</li><li>AWS ‚Äì RDS</li><li>Git/GitHub, Jenkins CI/CD</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: MS Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Role Description: </strong><p><br></p>Client &amp; Technical Solutions Engineers are responsible for developing and supporting the sale of Company software and services, packaging expert-level understanding of materials science and engineering principles within services and software workflows. Client &amp; Technical Solutions Engineers are part of the Technology Commercialization team which mission is to bring to market and drive the adoption of QuesTek‚Äôs proprietary ICME (Integrated Computational Materials Engineering) technology and engineering services, from its Materials by Design¬Æ methodology to its new ICMD¬Æ SaaS platform.<p><br></p><strong><u>Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable and support both the internal, service-oriented processes of QuesTek organization, and the external client, addressing the technical requirements of prospective engagements in both Corporate and Government market segments. </li><li>Participate in the origination and management of all pre-and post-sales client support initiatives, applying the services and software and digital technology of the Company, directly contributing to sustainable, profitable growth, and proprietary competitive advantage for the Company. </li><li>Work closely with the Director of Client Solutions, the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO), and across the Company from management to frontline employees by providing timely and business-leading technical information and proposed application solutions, including: (i) client services engagements and programs; (ii) communications content describing and positioning software and digital technology assets; and (iii) projected Company capabilities in response to new market segment requirements. </li><li>Principal contributor to and lead provider of technology qualifications and technical presentations to both prospective and existing clients, targeting senior executives. </li></ul><p><br></p>Client &amp; Technical Solutions Engineers function as a liaison between the materials engineering, modeling, and software development departments, and the commercialization team. In this capacity, the Technical Solutions Engineers work closely with the commercial team to develop and present technical presentations leveraging company history to present information of relevance to the client. Client &amp; Technical Solutions Engineers also assist the commercial team in qualifying new clients, assist in discovery calls, and produce the final statement of work.<p><br></p>On the engineering side, this role is responsible for knowledge and technology transfer from QuesTek‚Äôs internal technology development team - from materials engineering, modeling, and software development - to both the commercialization team and QuesTek‚Äôs clients. This role interfaces heavily with engineers to feed forward client issues and suggest possible new features within our service engagements and software offerings based on industry feedback. In other words, the goal of this group is to keep the technology commercial team focused on revenue driving activities and interactions while keeping the development and delivery engineering teams focused on project deliverables and software development.<p><br></p>A successful candidate for this role will have a strong technical background with a passion for applications of our ICME technology platform. They will be comfortable and enjoy working with clients, from their engineering staff all the way to the C-suite executives to find suitable solutions while communicating our technical capabilities and value propositions. As a mature start-up in rapid growth mode, this applicant should have strong problem-solving skills to find solutions to internal challenges. Flexibility and openness to take on new challenges to address business needs as they occur will also be necessary to succeed in the role.<p><br></p><strong><u>Individual Attributes</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to assess, formulate, communicate, adjust, and support the technological direction and technical sales requirements from existing and prospective clients. </li><li>An in-depth understanding of materials intensive companies that will help target clients, predict client needs, and participate in strategic market planning. </li><li>Ability to operate in a one-on-one client facing situations to both secure new clients and service existing clients. </li><li>Ability to give technical presentations to clients. </li><li>Highly skilled in conducting a technology/technical needs analysis by taking multiple inputs from clients and organizing concise, accurate and well scoped statements of work. </li><li>Knowledge and preferably prior experience with HubSpot, Salesforce, or similar CRM tools for customer and opportunity management. </li><li>A track record of success or a desire to develop skills in a technical sales role working with high level client personnel from the C-Suite down. </li><li>Ability to understand objectives of and readily communicate with high-level executives as well as engineering operatives in client companies; communicate client executive objectives as well as engineering project objectives in proposed solutions. </li><li>A strong entrepreneurial mindset to drive results in a scale-up environment working alongside a growing team of high caliber personnel. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Team Development Attributes</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building a new successful business within an established company. </li><li>Ability to collaborate with sales staff and technical people in a startup environment. </li><li>Ability to foster effective relationships with members of current QuesTek management team, and healthy relationships with other QuesTek employees. </li><li>Ability to qualify prospective clients and assist with the discovery process and needs assessment prior to the formulation of a formal proposal. </li><li>Experience creating compelling client proposals that align with their needs and present a return on investment for the client or address a business-critical need. </li><li>Experience in delivering multi-variate solutions derived from leveraging and operating a multi-level network business model, such as corporate engagements with industry leaders, federal consortia, Industry-University Comprehensive Research Centers (IUCRC‚Äôs), SBIR/STTR engagements, or other major subcontracting network. </li><li>Familiar with AWS cloud infrastructure and implementation to connect clients to QuesTek‚Äôs services and ICMD¬Æ platform. </li><li>Basic understanding of corporate finances, including P&amp;L, cash flow, indirect and direct costs; ability to devise and execute plans which support those structures and objectives. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications and Education: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an engineering or science discipline with experience applying such educational background to materials applications and processes. </li><li>2+ year working experience in materials intensive corporations preferred. </li><li>2+ year experience in customized solution selling situations; ability to transition between technical and business conversations and requirements. </li><li>Experience in integrated computational materials engineering (ICME) methodologies or CALPHAD based material simulations. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Working Conditions</u></strong><p><br></p>None: The worker is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions (as in typical office or administrative work).<p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally, and all other sedentary criteria are met. </li><li>Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; those activities where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly. </li><li>Hearing: Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and making fine discriminations in sound. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Direct reports: </strong>None

title: SENIOR INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYST
description: There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. in IT, Computer Science or Engineering </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go title: Azure Infrastructure Engineer - Remote (FT)
description: <p><strong>About the Position </strong></p><p>The Senior Monitoring and Availability Engineer will provide monitoring and availability support of Enterprise, Data Center, and Cloud environments. This specifically includes hands-on experience deploying, updating, and supporting enterprise monitoring applications. The candidate should have an advanced understanding of monitoring tools including (but not limited to) Solarwinds, Service NOW, and Cisco Stealthwatch, including the underlying SQL database. Additionally, a strong working knowledge in various technologies, including (but not limited to) servers, storage, virtualization, networking, and infrastructure management. The candidate‚Äôs work is performed by following procedures and vendor documentation in a team environment, with frequent evaluation from and under close supervision of the Manager of Network Engineering.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Maintain existing operational monitoring environments, including (but not limited to) various Solarwinds Orion modules and Cisco Stealthwatch.</li><li>Perform routine database maintenance, ensuring the platform(s) remain fully optimized and functional.</li><li>Add/Change/Delete applications/nodes/interfaces from monitoring platform(s), ensuring that we have an accurate inventory across the organization.</li><li>Generate new dashboards, reports, and alerts from monitoring platform(s) for various Operational and Engineering teams.</li><li>Work with various teams to integrate platform(s), including but not limited to Service NOW.</li><li>Work with various teams to troubleshoot any monitoring related issues that may occur, including but not limited an inability to properly poll specific nodes/applications.</li></ul><p>¬∑ Establish a monitoring reference architecture and alerting standards, delivering streamlined alert notifications to various teams across the Organization.</p><ul><li>Serve as an advanced technical resource on a functional basis for the resolution of complex service impacting issues.</li><li>Required to work hours other than regular schedule such as nights, weekends, and holidays when needed.</li><li>Maintain a positive work attitude, a high level of communication, and cordial relations that foster teamwork among all teams.</li><li>Work both independently and as part of a team to deliver results both on time and budget.</li></ul><p> <strong>Required Experience:</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in an IT-related field or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Advanced experience in Solarwinds Orion modules, including but not limited to SAM, NPM, and NCM.</li><li>Strong understanding of API, SNMP, SNMP Traps, Syslog, and WMI.</li><li>Strong understanding and demonstrated ability in SQL administration and SQL query language.</li><li>Scripting skills using various platforms such as PowerShell, and Python preferred.</li><li>Knowledge of complementary platforms like Service NOW, Infoblox, GitHub, and other DevOps Tools preferred.</li><li>Knowledge of cloud software (both public and private) such as AWS VPC, Azure ExpressRoute, and Cisco ACI preferred.</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Disclosure required under applicable municipal regulations in NY and NJ, as well as the law in Colorado: The expected salary range for this position is $100k to $130k and will be impacted by factors such as the successful candidate‚Äôs skills, experience and working location, as well as the specific position‚Äôs business line, scope and level. HUB International is proud to offer comprehensive benefit and total compensation packages which could include health/dental/vision/life/disability insurance, FSA, HSA and 401(k) accounts, paid-time-off benefits, and eligible bonuses, equity and commissions for some positions.</p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you‚Äôll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it ‚Äî we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. We‚Äôre all about people, and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li><li>Be able to participate in 24x7 support rotation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here‚Äôs what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors ‚Äì Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years ‚Äì (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years CICS Systems</li><li>5+ years of Mainframe knowledge</li><li>Knowledge of Mainframe MQ</li><li>Knowledge of Mainframe DB2</li><li>Knowledge of Mainframe Moderization</li><li>Knowledge of Parallel Sysplex</li><li>Knowledge of CTG and zOS Connect</li><li>Knowledge of VSAM</li><li>Knowledge of JCL, TSO REXX, ISPF, and other core mainframe skills</li><li>Knowledge of Mainframe Communication Server</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)
