title: Client & Technical Solutions Engineer
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>The Developer is responsible for design, delivery, quality, and continual improvement of application solutions for North America Supply Chain. This role is responsible for deliverable timeliness, efficiency and quality related to application development focused on, but not limited to, areas such as Supply Chain Visibility, Supply Chain Optimization, Integrated Planning/CPFR, Restaurant Analytics, and Supply Chain simulations.<br><br>They will support the analytics and product leadership in the development of a solutions roadmap, develop an implementation plan, and support the activities to ensure timely completion of product/project deliverables. Managing the quality of the deliverables will be an essential part of this role.<br><br>Be current on trends and developments in the market with an eye on bringing in the new advancements into our portfolio of solutions. This role provides an opportunity to shape our thinking on how our analytic products and services are designed, developed, and delivered.<br><br>This role will be part of the Analytics and Insights team.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong><strong>WHAT YOU WILL DO<br></strong><ul><li>Responsible for working with the Analytics and Insights team to design, develop and deliver supply chain solutions to support regional needs </li><li>Drive operational efficiencies and effectiveness though automation and digitization of supply chain solutions, and develop and deliver consistent and scalable business solutions </li><li>Support product delivery leveraging the Agile / DevOps best practices</li><li>Provide consultative and advisory services to delivery teams to meet customer expectations</li><li>Collaborate with Technology to ensure new products are aligned with agreed architecture and infrastructure </li><li>Support new solutions development in North America </li><li>Update and support the Product Roadmaps </li><li>Support North America user engagement in new product design, development, and deployment<br><br></li></ul><strong>About You<br><br></strong><strong>Desired Skills &amp; Experience<br><br></strong><strong>Knowledge And Experience<br></strong><ul><li>Programming experience with Python, Java, JavaScript (React.js, Node.js, etc.), API‚Äôs;</li><li>Working knowledge with technology domains such as: SaaS technologies, application configuration/packaging for cloud computing, AWS, Azure, MS SQL</li><li>Experience with developing internal business applications and business integration</li><li>Experience implementing, customizing, and integrating third-party applications (preferably in supply chain space)</li><li>Experience in multiple full system implementation (e.g., analyze, design, build, test, implement, support)</li><li>Experience in digitizing and automating processes and architecting solutions in a consistent and scalable manner</li><li>Familiarity and experience with Agile / DevOps process and framework</li><li>2+ years of real-life experience preferred<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong><strong>TOTAL REWARDS<br><br></strong>Our total rewards philosophy integrates programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, corporate culture, corporate citizenship and work-life balance. title: Software Engineer (Chicago, IL or Moline, IL)
description: <strong>Our Story </strong><p><br></p>Founded in 2008, Hightower is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. Hightower‚Äôs capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of ‚Äúwell-th. rebalanced.‚Äù Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., we operate as a registered investment advisor (RIA).<p><br></p>Our commitment to our culture is demonstrated every day through the Hightower Way. By joining Hightower, you will build a community of inclusive relationships, take proactive ownership, embrace others‚Äô perspectives, and have an uncompromising dedication to excellence.<p><br></p><strong> Your Future Team</strong><p><br></p>The Hightower Platform and Innovation group is growing and looking to add an Email Security Engineer, to work directly within the Technology Infrastructure team. This team is responsible for the firms; local/cloud, network, and unified communications infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong>What You‚Äôll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Serve as a Hightower brand ambassador by upholding The Hightower Way cultural elements ‚Äì Mission, Purpose, V.A.L.U.E. Experience, Commitment and Standards, promoting excellence in the internal and external client experience during every encounter </li><li> Improve consistency in every client and colleague encounter by embodying the core principles of our Hightower V.A.L.U.E. Experience (Validate, Actively Listen, Leverage Resources, Understand Ownership, Express Gratitude) </li><li> Partner with cross-discipline team members to support collaboration and promote a positive client experience </li><li> Domain and Certificate management, &gt; 120 and growing domains </li><li> Act as the contact for resolving Email Security System operational tickets ensuring resolution as per defined SLAs </li><li> Monitor email traffic and respond to security alerts </li><li> Troubleshoot issues related to non-delivery of email related arising from Data Loss Prevention, intrusion and threat prevention </li><li> Ensure the Email security platform is configured and updated with heightened Cyber Security features and rules </li><li> Create Standard Operating Procedures and other similar documentation </li><li> Help implement counter-measures or mitigating control for email security issues <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You‚Äôll Bring</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Minimum 3 years of IT/email security experience in enterprise environments </li><li> Minimum 3 years of experience working with email threat prevention platforms in complex email delivery systems </li><li> In-depth knowledge of DNS, SMTP, DMARC, DKIM, and SPF </li><li> In-depth knowledge of Microsoft 365 online email and Secure Email Gateway such as Proofpoint Security Platform </li><li> In-depth knowledge of message archiving and compliance management </li><li> Proficient in the use of automation tools, configuration management solutions, DevOps principles, and data analytics </li><li> Working experience integrating SaaS services and APIs </li><li> Familiarity with the CI/CD process </li><li> Experience with Cloud architecture </li><li> Familiarity with Azure; Platform, AD, Graph API </li><li> Familiarity with scripting and using scripting languages (Python, Powershell) </li><li> Security and cloud certifications (CISSP, CCSP, AWS, Azure) <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Coverage on the first day of employment for Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance </li><li> Paid Parental Leave (16 weeks for primary caregiver and 8 weeks for secondary caregiver) </li><li> Flexible PTO Plan </li><li> Hybrid Model Work Schedule (50% in office) </li><li> 401k Matching Plan </li><li> HSA Employer Contributions </li><li> Student Loan Assistance </li><li> Pet Insurance </li><li> We commit to a transparent, people-first environment where talent is maximized through our diverse, equitable and inclusive community </li><li> We nurture a spirit of belonging, are energized by challenges, celebrate our successes, and achieve individual and collective well-th goals <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER: </strong> Hightower is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer-related), gender identity or expression, genetic information including sickle cell or hemoglobin C trait, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local law.<p><br></p><em> You are a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident or possess other unrestricted U.S. work authorization and will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future. </em><p><br></p>Apply Now

title: Senior Monitoring and Availability Engineer - Remote
description: Help global companies embrace the latest private cloud infrastructure, Linux and cloud native operations, and open source applications. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Linux Ubuntu, OpenStack, Kubernetes and a wide range of associated technology.<br><br>This role has very diverse responsibilities. The team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.<br><br>The people who love this role are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training.<br><br>What you'll do:<br><ul><li>Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications</li><li>Design and deploy clouds and applications for external customers</li><li>Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like OpenStack, Kubernetes, Ceph, Hadoop and Spark either On-Premises or in Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)</li><li>Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values</li><li>Work from the comfort of your home</li><li>Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events<br><br></li></ul>Who you are:<br><ul><li>University degree in Computer Science or related software engineering expertise</li><li>You have expertise in AI/ML and MLOps</li><li>You have practical knowledge of Linux and networking</li><li>You have sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts &amp; technologies, such as Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc. </li><li>You have an intermediate level of Python programming skills</li><li>You are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people</li><li>You have a demonstrated drive for continual learning</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills (English, Spanish/French a bonus)</li><li>You have great organisational skills and follow-up reliably on commitments<br><br></li></ul>What you'll learn<br><ul><li>OpenStack and Kubernetes infrastructure</li><li>Linux Ubuntu and networking knowledge</li><li>Wide range of open source applications and skills</li><li>Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses </li><li>Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools <br><br></li></ul>We offer:<br><ul><li>Learning and development tuition reimbursement</li><li>18 weeks parental leave (USA) </li><li>Diversity Resource Groups</li><li>Work from home</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual leave</li><li>Priority Pass for travel<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Canonical<br><br></strong>Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realize the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.<br><br><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background leads to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.<br><br></em>#stack<br><br>

title: Java Engineer (W2)
description: <strong>Job Purpose</strong><p><br></p>The Repower engineering team currently has an opening for an experienced engineer who is focused individual and has analytical approach to problem solving. The engineer will be responsible for carrying out required duties not only to support production projects but also to support inquiry team with proposals for the repower engineering department, including design, research, prototyping, engineering documentation, estimating and participate in process improvement activities. The successful candidate will report directly to the manager of the engineering team and collaborate with other departments (such as purchasing, operations, inquiry, sales, program management and manufacturing) on ongoing proposals, production and R&amp;D projects.<p><br></p><strong>Req ID</strong><p><br></p>8409BR<p><br></p><strong>Work Location Options</strong><p><br></p>LaGrange, IL<p><br></p><strong>City</strong><p><br></p>La Grange<p><br></p><strong>State:</strong><p><br></p>Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>Railroads transport goods and people millions of miles every day. At Progress Rail, we believe in going the distance with them. We are looking for talented and innovative team players to address the challenges of the rail industry today, ensuring success for the future. Build a long-term career with opportunities for growth and advancement as part of a vibrant network of close to 200 global locations. Our innovative team members work together to forge the bridge between ideas and success!<p><br></p>As a Caterpillar company, Progress Rail is an integrated rolling stock and infrastructure provider, delivering a full range of products and services to domestic and international railroad customers. Our customers enjoy one-stop shopping and comprehensive railway solutions ‚Äì whether it rolls on the rail or is the rail itself. From locomotives, transit, freight cars and engines, to tracks, signals and advanced technology, we ensure customers can count on us to meet their needs.<p><br></p>Learn how we keep our customers rolling by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn, and by visiting progressrail.com .<p><br></p><strong>Key Job Elements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Incumbent will have overall design and technical responsibility for the project as a whole. Multiple projects will be worked simultaneously;</li><li> Respond to new sales inquiries in a timely manner and create customer technical proposals;</li><li> Undertake task such locomotive performance studies, project cost estimates, and engineering cost estimates;</li><li> Interpret customer requirements and translate into locomotive engineering specifications;</li><li> Applicant must be capable and comfortable making timely judgement calls on technical issues, based on often-incomplete customer requirements;</li><li> Create engineering requirements documents and specifications for execution of projects, translating the project commercial requirements into specific engineering design deliverables;</li><li> Guide the design of the product to minimize cost and schedule. Contain scope creep on projects;</li><li> Conduct field testing for demonstration of contract requirements and for certification purposes;</li><li>Attend meetings with customers, vendors, and certifying agencies, making presentations and negotiating technical issues;</li><li> Determining customer‚Äôs requirements and translating them into an actionable plan;</li><li> Organizing many tasks into a timeline. Holding required meetings with to ensure specification compliance and project execution in accordance with time and budget restrictions;</li><li> Making sure that all health, safety, legal and railroad regulatory (FRA, CFR, AAR) requirements are being met throughout the process;</li><li> Up to 25% travel may be required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education / Training</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> BS in mechanical or electrical engineering, or related discipline.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications And Experience</strong><p><br></p>Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> Knowledge of locomotive structure, powerplant, cooling system, electrical system, and pneumatic system;</li><li> Experience with diesel engine installation and application requirements;</li><li> Knowledge of locomotive performance characteristics and ability to address customer operational requirements;</li><li> High level of analytical abilities where problems are very complex;</li><li> High level of written and oral communication skills;</li><li> Ability to travel as required.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred:<p><br></p><ul><li> Expected high level of analytical ability where problems are unusual and difficult;</li><li> Thorough understanding of complex mechanical and/or electrical concepts;</li><li> Previous locomotive or heavy equipment design familiarity and test experience;</li><li> Experience with both EMD and Caterpillar diesel engine characteristics and requirements;</li><li> Familiarity with AAR and UIC standards relating to rolling stock;</li><li> Experience with project management methodology;</li><li> Familiarity with EMD engineering processes and systems;</li><li> Prior experience in field test, commissioning, or field service engineering.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential And Physical Activities Functions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strength ‚Äì Position typically involves work in an office environment with occasional visits to an industrial environment. Frequent/constant sitting. Occasional standing and walking. Occasional light to medium-level lifting or carrying (up to 30 pounds);</li><li> Motion ‚Äì Position regularly requires standard motions associated with working in an office environment. Depending on assigned project, position occasionally require motions involved in an industrial working environment, including some low to intense levels of pushing, pulling, climbing, balancing, crouching, stooping, kneeling, reaching, grasping, such as climbing onto and off of locomotives;</li><li> Vision/Hearing Requirements ‚Äì Frequent verbal communications, including both talking and hearing;</li><li> Work Environment ‚Äì Position is typically located in an office environment with occasional visits to an industrial environment which may include a non-temperature-controlled environment, as well as exposure to noise (85+ decibels), occasional exposure to temperature changes, heavy machinery and other hazardous working conditions requiring the use of PPE. Position requires travel as necessary, both domestic and international;</li><li> Emotional Demands ‚Äì Very high level of responsibility. Must be able to coordinate diverse aspects of a project. Requires significant interpersonal skills while sustaining very high standards;</li><li> Safety ‚Äì Position occasionally requires the use of Personal Protective Equipment during visits to industrial areas.</li></ul><p><br></p>The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities required of a Locomotive Repower Systems Engineer.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Progress Rail offers an excellent total compensation package,* including competitive salary, paid time off for vacation and holidays, 401(k) plan with company match, medical/dental/vision/life/disability insurance and flexible spending accounts. description_json: <strong>Job Purpose</strong><p><br></p>The Repower engineering team currently has an opening for an experienced engineer who is focused individual and has analytical approach to problem solving. The engineer will be responsible for carrying out required duties not only to support production projects but also to support inquiry team with proposals for the repower engineering department, including design, research, prototyping, engineering documentation, estimating and participate in process improvement activities. The successful candidate will report directly to the manager of the engineering team and collaborate with other departments (such as purchasing, operations, inquiry, sales, program management and manufacturing) on ongoing proposals, production and R&amp;D projects.<p><br></p><strong>Req ID</strong><p><br></p>8409BR<p><br></p><strong>Work Location Options</strong><p><br></p>LaGrange, IL<p><br></p><strong>City</strong><p><br></p>La Grange<p><br></p><strong>State:</strong><p><br></p>Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>Railroads transport goods and people millions of miles every day. At Progress Rail, we believe in going the distance with them. We are looking for talented and innovative team players to address the challenges of the rail industry today, ensuring success for the future. Build a long-term career with opportunities for growth and advancement as part of a vibrant network of close to 200 global locations. Our innovative team members work together to forge the bridge between ideas and success!<p><br></p>As a Caterpillar company, Progress Rail is an integrated rolling stock and infrastructure provider, delivering a full range of products and services to domestic and international railroad customers. Our customers enjoy one-stop shopping and comprehensive railway solutions ‚Äì whether it rolls on the rail or is the rail itself. From locomotives, transit, freight cars and engines, to tracks, signals and advanced technology, we ensure customers can count on us to meet their needs.<p><br></p>Learn how we keep our customers rolling by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn, and by visiting progressrail.com .<p><br></p><strong>Key Job Elements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Incumbent will have overall design and technical responsibility for the project as a whole. Multiple projects will be worked simultaneously;</li><li> Respond to new sales inquiries in a timely manner and create customer technical proposals;</li><li> Undertake task such locomotive performance studies, project cost estimates, and engineering cost estimates;</li><li> Interpret customer requirements and translate into locomotive engineering specifications;</li><li> Applicant must be capable and comfortable making timely judgement calls on technical issues, based on often-incomplete customer requirements;</li><li> Create engineering requirements documents and specifications for execution of projects, translating the project commercial requirements into specific engineering design deliverables;</li><li> Guide the design of the product to minimize cost and schedule. Contain scope creep on projects;</li><li> Conduct field testing for demonstration of contract requirements and for certification purposes;</li><li>Attend meetings with customers, vendors, and certifying agencies, making presentations and negotiating technical issues;</li><li> Determining customer‚Äôs requirements and translating them into an actionable plan;</li><li> Organizing many tasks into a timeline. Holding required meetings with to ensure specification compliance and project execution in accordance with time and budget restrictions;</li><li> Making sure that all health, safety, legal and railroad regulatory (FRA, CFR, AAR) requirements are being met throughout the process;</li><li> Up to 25% travel may be required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education / Training</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> BS in mechanical or electrical engineering, or related discipline.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications And Experience</strong><p><br></p>Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> Knowledge of locomotive structure, powerplant, cooling system, electrical system, and pneumatic system;</li><li> Experience with diesel engine installation and application requirements;</li><li> Knowledge of locomotive performance characteristics and ability to address customer operational requirements;</li><li> High level of analytical abilities where problems are very complex;</li><li> High level of written and oral communication skills;</li><li> Ability to travel as required.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred:<p><br></p><ul><li> Expected high level of analytical ability where problems are unusual and difficult;</li><li> Thorough understanding of complex mechanical and/or electrical concepts;</li><li> Previous locomotive or heavy equipment design familiarity and test experience;</li><li> Experience with both EMD and Caterpillar diesel engine characteristics and requirements;</li><li> Familiarity with AAR and UIC standards relating to rolling stock;</li><li> Experience with project management methodology;</li><li> Familiarity with EMD engineering processes and systems;</li><li> Prior experience in field test, commissioning, or field service engineering.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential And Physical Activities Functions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strength ‚Äì Position typically involves work in an office environment with occasional visits to an industrial environment. Frequent/constant sitting. Occasional standing and walking. Occasional light to medium-level lifting or carrying (up to 30 pounds);</li><li> Motion ‚Äì Position regularly requires standard motions associated with working in an office environment. Depending on assigned project, position occasionally require motions involved in an industrial working environment, including some low to intense levels of pushing, pulling, climbing, balancing, crouching, stooping, kneeling, reaching, grasping, such as climbing onto and off of locomotives;</li><li> Vision/Hearing Requirements ‚Äì Frequent verbal communications, including both talking and hearing;</li><li> Work Environment ‚Äì Position is typically located in an office environment with occasional visits to an industrial environment which may include a non-temperature-controlled environment, as well as exposure to noise (85+ decibels), occasional exposure to temperature changes, heavy machinery and other hazardous working conditions requiring the use of PPE. Position requires travel as necessary, both domestic and international;</li><li> Emotional Demands ‚Äì Very high level of responsibility. Must be able to coordinate diverse aspects of a project. Requires significant interpersonal skills while sustaining very high standards;</li><li> Safety ‚Äì Position occasionally requires the use of Personal Protective Equipment during visits to industrial areas.</li></ul><p><br></p>The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities required of a Locomotive Repower Systems Engineer.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Progress Rail offers an excellent total compensation package,* including competitive salary, paid time off for vacation and holidays, 401(k) plan with company match, medical/dental/vision/life/disability insurance and flexible spending accounts. Relocation assistance may be available for some positions.<p><br></p><ul><li>Benefits eligibility differs by job position and employment status - governing plan documents control such benefits. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>EEO</strong><p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer ‚Äì Race/Color/Sex/Religion/National Origin/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Vets/Disabilities<p><br></p><strong>Job Category</strong><p><br></p>Engineering<p><br></p><strong>PRS Facility Location</strong><p><br></p>EMD HQ LaGrange, IL- 400

title: Cloud Field Engineer - Americas (Remote)
description: This opportunity is working directly with a leading mission-critical data center developer / wholesaler / colo provider. This firm provides data center solutions custom-fit to the requirements of their client's mission-critical operational facilities. They provide reliability of mission-critical facilities for many of the world's largest organizations facilities supporting Enterprise Clients and Hyperscale Companies. This opportunity provides a career-growth minded role with exciting projects with leading-edge technology and innovation as well as competitive salaries and benefits.<br><br><strong>Data Center Facility Engineer - Chicago, IL<br><br></strong>We are looking for a Data Center Facility Engineer to support a critical data center. The Critical Facility Engineer will be responsible for monitoring compliance with contractual commitments, directing technical and administrative tasks related to the operation of the critical facility infrastructure and assuring compliance with company‚Äôs policies and procedures. The Data Center is a 7x24x365 a year operation.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Troubleshoot and Run Diagnostics, Conduct Preventive Maintenance and Emergency Repairs on Critical Facilities Equipment within the Data Center as specified and on schedule</li><li>Participates in the preparation of analyses and reports on the data center infrastructure, develops project plans and conducts briefings and presentations</li><li>Partner when necessary with sub-contractors and vendors</li><li>Operate and perform both routine and emergency service on a variety of state of the art critical systems, including but not limited to; Critical power - low/medium voltage switchgear, diesel generators, paralleling switchboards, UPS, PDU, and building monitoring systems</li><li>Ensures that operational, maintenance and emergency methods of procedure (MOP‚Äôs and SOP‚Äôs) are developed and strictly adhered to</li><li>Assist with CMMS database management</li></ul> <strong>Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of relevant / technical knowledge and practical experience of Critical Facilities Operations with Electrical and Mechanical / HVAC equipment such as: UPS, Generators, Switchgears, PDU's, CRAC Units, DC Power Systems, CRAH Units, Chillers, Air handling units, computer grade cooling systems, CRAH Units, DC Power Systems, and building monitoring/control systems</li><li>Must have experience in operating, troubleshooting and maintenance of Mission Critical Mechanical and/or Electrical Support Systems</li><li>Previous experience in the Military / Military veterans in all branches that have experience with Electrical / Mechanical is a huge plus (Navy Nukes- EMN, ETN, MMNs, Seabees, Army - Power Generation, Air Force ‚Äì Power Production, Generator Techs, Maritime, Coast Guard, etc.)</li><li>Strong verbal, written communications skills</li><li>Experience working with various computer systems and applications</li></ul> <strong>Submittal Instructions:<br><br></strong>Please send your resume to resume@pkaza.com ( resume at pkaza dot com ) with 16210436 in the subject. After applying, if you have further questions, you may call 973-895-5200 and ask for Iggy. You can also submit via our career portal and take a look at other Critical Facility openings we are working on at, https://www.pkaza.com/jobs/<br><br>If you are in Data Center Facilities but this opportunity is not what you are looking for let‚Äôs still talk. New openings are coming in weekly and others we are not allowed to post.<br><br>We also not only keep leads confidential but pay for referrals as well.<br><br>Company offers competitive salaries and benefits package including medical insurance, a 401(k) plan.<br><br><em>EOE/AA Employer M/F/D/V<br><br></em><em>Pkaza, LLC is a third party employment firm. All fees assessed by Pkaza will be paid by our employer that we represent and not by the candidate</em>

title: IICS Developer
description: There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we‚Äôre all about at John Deere. And it‚Äôs why we‚Äôre investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world‚Äôs brightest minds are tackling the world‚Äôs biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we‚Äôll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>Deere &amp; Company is seeking a Senior Software Engineer in Chicago, IL with the following requirements: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Technology, Computer Science, or related field or foreign equivalent plus 8 years related experience. Required skills: Experience using SAP commerce Hybris to develop business to client and business to business ecommerce IT Solutions (7 yrs); Experience using Java/J2EE to develop enterprise IT solutions for ecommerce, Banking, Semi Conductor, Health Care and Manufacturing Domain (8 yrs); Experience with AWS Cloud to build Enterprise IT and Microservices solutions (3 yrs); Experience with Spring MVC to build ecommerce and enterprise IT solutions (7 yrs). 50% remote work allowed.<p><br></p>Please apply on-line at www.JohnDeere.com/USJobs and search for Job Posting Number 2023063.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Systems Engineer, Locomotive Repowers
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking a Kafka Cloud Engineer. Candidate will perform a range of activities required to both maintain and continuously automate a large, complex virtualization and cloud-based computing environment. In addition, you will provide technical guidance within the team on kafka and when called upon, serve as a technical liaison between internal departments. This will involve utilizing best practices for the management, architecture, configuration, DR, administration, and automation of the enterprise server virtualization environment with cloud technologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide professional input to the organization for cloud and virtualization end-to-end architecture and IaaS, as well as PaaS and SaaS solutions such as AWS RedShift</li><li>Develop and maintain a library of deployable, tested, and documented automation design scripts, processes, and procedures</li><li>Enable DevOps development activities and complex development tasks that will involve working with tools such as Docker, Kafka and container management systems</li><li>Provide advanced Kafka administrative support</li><li>Design, configure, implement and support an automated workflow for cloud and virtual environment provisioning, with a particular focus on Kafka clusters.</li><li>Implement production changes during defined maintenance windows and support on call rotation</li><li>Perform cloud computing and virtual environment build-outs, software installation, maintenance and support</li><li>Write and maintain documentation of relevant operating procedures and processes</li><li>Design, develop, and build the business's cloud infrastructure architecture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience with Confluent's Kafka Products and Platforms</li><li>[Working knowledge of infrastructure design and components, such as: Servers, operating systems, networks, and storage (basic) and (advanced) knowledge of Confluent Kafka.</li><li>Experience with architecting, implementing and maintaining highly available mission critical environments for 24/7 availability</li><li>Experience working in an environment with a defined production change control process</li><li>[Demonstrates history of working within deadlines and ability to work well under pressure</li><li>Strong hands-on experience Scripting/development skills in Python, Ruby, Go, Java, JavaScript, etc. in a corporate environment </li><li>Hands-on experience with: Terraform, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Kafka, Github, OpenShift, and configuration management tools such as Ansible.</li><li>Relevant experience with configuration and implementation of IaaS, Infrastructure as code, AWS.</li><li>AWS Solutions Architect Associate Certification or higher strongly desired</li><li>Relevant industry certifications such as Confluent Certified Administrator for Apache Kafka</li><li>Certificates or Licenses:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.), or equivalent combination of education and experience required</li><li>3+ years experience in IT systems installation, operations, administration, and maintenance of virtualized Servers/cloud systems and Kafka systems.</li></ul>

title: Hybrid System Engineer (Migrations Team) MSP
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>The ERP Developer II is responsible for making development modifications to the firm‚Äôs PeopleSoft Finance system. In this role, the ERP Developer II is charged with analyzing internal user needs to accurately design, construct, and maintain the PeopleSoft Finance system to meet the individual needs of the user.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Administers the day-to-day functions of the PeopleSoft Finance system </li><li> Designs new and modifies existing modules/components based on requirements </li><li> Provides Level IV support for PeopleSoft Finance system issues and questions </li><li> Provides Level IV support for specific applications, as needed </li><li> Facilitates meetings to discuss project requirements, as needed </li><li> Coaches Application Support team members on best practices and steps for developing sound support and coding decisions </li><li> Devises strategic solutions to resolve issues while keeping the system operational </li><li> Partners with other members of the Applications Services team, as well as other resources within National IT, Human Resources and/or Finance to resolve issues </li><li> Consults with other Application Services team members to analysis diverse issues </li><li> Manages multiple projects and/or tasks simultaneously </li><li> Partners with ERP Developers to find a timely resolution to complex issues and escalates critical issues to management by developing and implementing strategies as appropriate </li><li> Consults ERP Manager and ERP Support Team regarding advance support needs due to highly complex issues within a hosted environment </li><li> Provides accurate estimates related to project workload and deadlines </li><li> Participates in weekly support meetings with hosting provider </li><li> Participates in design meetings as appropriate </li><li> Serves as the Secondary Support person for after-hours support, as needed </li><li> Other duties as required </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Supervisory Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> N/A </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent, required </li><li> Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or Information Systems, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Five (5) or more years of experience with developing PeopleSoft modules utilizing object based PeopleCode, required </li><li> Five (5) or more years of experience with developing in PL/SQL utilizing SQL Server and/or Oracle database environments, required </li><li> Three (3) or more years of experience of development using PeopleTools, required </li><li> Prior experience working with and configuring PeopleSoft‚Äôs Integration Broker service, required </li><li> Prior experience working with COBOL in PeopleSoft, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>License/Certifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certifications as PeopleSoft Developer, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software</strong>  <ul><li> Experience with the following products, required:</li><ul><li> PeopleSoft Application Designer </li><li> PeopleSoft Security Objects </li><li> Microsoft SQL Server </li><li> SQL Plus </li></ul><li> Experience with the following products, preferred:</li><ul><li> Microsoft Visual Studio </li><li> Azure DevOps </li><li> Microsoft SQL Reporting Services </li><li> Microsoft SQL Integration Services </li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Language</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> N/A </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Excellent interpersonal and customer relationship skills </li><li> Capacity to work in a deadline-driven environment while handle multiple complex projects/tasks simultaneously with a focus on details </li><li> Capable of successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment </li><li> Ability to rely on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals </li><li> Capable of working well under pressure while dealing with unexpected problems in a professional manner </li><li> Capacity to communicate and interact with all levels of employees and management </li><li> Ability to interact and build relationships and consensus among people </li><li> Advanced knowledge of database optimization efforts such as hint, statistics and other related experience, preferred </li><li> Capacity to consistently produce clean coding and adhere to appropriate documentation standards </li></ul><p><br></p>Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.<p><br></p>Range: $90,000 - $109,000<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>BDO delivers assurance, tax, digital technology solutions and financial advisory services to clients throughout the country and around the globe. We offer numerous industry-specific practices, world-class resources, and an unparalleled commitment to meeting our clients‚Äô needs. We currently serve more than 400 publicly traded domestic and international clients.<p><br></p><ul><li>Unparalleled partner-involvement </li><li>Deep industry knowledge and participation</li><li>Geographic coverage across the U.S.</li><li>Cohesive global network </li><li>Focused capabilities across disciplines</li></ul><p><br></p>BDO brings world-class resources and exceptional service to each and every one of our clients. BDO USA is a member of BDO International, the world‚Äôs fifth largest accounting network.<p><br></p>BDO offers a competitive Total Rewards package that encompass so much more than ‚Äì ‚Äútraditional benefits‚Äù. Our wide range of rewards and our employees‚Äô ability to customize rewards to their individual needs are two of the reasons why BDO has been honored with so many workplace awards, including 100 Best Companies for Working Parents, Working Mother 100 Best Companies, Top Entry Level Employer, 2022 National Best &amp; Brightest Companies to Work For and more.<p><br></p><strong>Some Examples Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive pay and eligibility for an annual performance bonus. </li><li>A 401k plan plus an employer match</li><li>Comprehensive, medical, dental, vision, FSA, and prescription insurance from day one</li><li> Competitive Paid Time Off with daily accrual from day one of employment, plus paid holidays </li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Adoption Assistance</li><li>Firm paid life insurance</li><li>Wellness programs</li><li>Additional offerings include BDO Flex, Group Legal insurance, Pet insurance and Long-Term Care Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p>Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements.<p><br></p>Click here to find out more!<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.<p><br></p>BDO USA, LLP is an EO employer M/F/Veteran/Disability<p><br></p>

title: R DEVELOPER
description: <strong><u>Purpose</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description : </strong><p><br></p>The AEM Developer position is responsible for the design and development of architectural approaches and solutions on the enterprise AEM platform based on business needs/requirements and develop implementation plans, estimates, and budgets in conjunction and collaboration with the PM, BA and other team members.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Ensure and drive the success of AEM enterprise-level integration and development efforts affecting upstream and downstream legacy systems.</li><li> Work with functional groups (e.g., project management, network operations, etc.) in order to provide tightly integrated solutions between the web applications and the legacy backend systems.</li><li> Build strong partnerships with business stakeholders and works with product owners to develop and maintain an enterprise-wide, prioritized AEM roadmap in conjunction with the legacy retirement roadmap.</li><li> Ensure quality and on-time delivery on projects with associated documentation, user training, and operationalization; drive engineering best practices throughout the project lifecycle.</li><li> Ownership and accountability for delivering quality outcomes that balance technical, business and operational goals.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience And Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Deep knowledge of Adobe Experience Manager and AEM Core components (Example: Sling, OSGI, JCR, Dispatcher).</li><li> Strong knowledge and experience in integration with components of Adobe Marketing Cloud (including Adobe Target, Adobe Analytics, and Campaign) and Adobe Social</li><li> Be well-versed with AEM workflows setup and maintenance as well as User and Group Management</li><li> Ability to fine-tune AEM application for optimal performance, including configuring Threads, Heap, GC Policy. FEO, JS and CSS minification and optimization.</li><li> Familiar with application profilers</li><li> Strong Java (OSGi, JSP, Servlets) and web development (HTML, JS, CSS, jQuery, Bootstrap, etc.) background with experience building cutting edge web &amp; responsive mobile experiences. Hands-on experience with Sightly (AEM Templating language) and CoralUI/TouchUI frameworks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven track record to delivering enterprise initiatives working across organizational boundaries and building strong technical delivery teams</li><li> Strong sense of ownership and accountability with a commitment to delivering quality outcomes that balance technical and business goals</li><li> Broad web and digital knowledge, an aptitude for troubleshooting and problem solving as well as mentoring/guiding other members of the team.</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li> Ability to establish goals and set clear expectations, prioritize activities, and follow through to completion</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or relegated field<p><br></p>Let me know if any questions

title: Telco Cloud Field Engineer
description: <strong>Hi<br><br></strong><strong>Role- C# Embedded Developer<br><br></strong><strong>Location - Wheeling, IL (Onsite)<br><br></strong><strong>Mode- Contract<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description ::<br><br></strong>Design and develop C#.Net based embedded software through the full SDLC<br><br>Implement applications that run on the Linux OS<br><br>Write software design specifications<br><br>Participate in peer source code and design reviews<br><br>Mentor junior level engineers<br><br>Assume an Onsite Coordinator role within the project by facilitating communication between Client and Actalent Offshore Team, coordinate with Client stakeholders to understand requirements and architecture, and clarifying validation failures to Actalent Offshore Team<br><br>This role will serve as an escalation point for technical and customer issues that may arise<br><br>Collaborate with the Project Manager on the quality and timeliness of the deliverable to ensure compliance to Quality Management System processes.<br><br>Note: this role will not have any direct employee reports and is approximately 75% hands on, performing software design, development, and testing.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications<br><br>BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science and at least 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer/Developer<br><br>Experience leading engineers including training, mentorship, clarification of requirements and architecture<br><br>Experience planning and delegating tasks based on evaluation of capability with a project team<br><br>Experience with the full SDLC using the C# programming language, OOP architecture, and .Net framework<br><br>Ability to read Java code<br><br>Experience with Linux based embedded software<br><br>Ability to create supporting documentation such as design documents, architecture diagrams, test procedures and reports.<br><br>Good oral and written communication skills with the ability to professionally support periodic communication to management and technical teams<br><br>Experience with Agile Scrum development methodologies and common workflow tools: GIT, Jira, etc<br><br><strong><u>Desired Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Understanding of REST APIs<br><br>Experience designing software for a distributed network for CAN or Ethernet communication<br><br>Experience designing software for display systems and closed loop control systems<br><br>Experience with common debugging tools such as oscilloscopes, network analyzer, emulators

title: Data Center Facility Engineer
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client‚Äôs purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. </li><li>Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. </li><li>Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. </li><li>Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. </li><li>Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. </li><li>May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. </li><li>Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. </li><li>Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles</li><li>Demonstrates project management and administration ability</li><li>Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments</li><li>Demonstrate customer engagement skills</li><li>Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge</li><li>Good verbal communication skills</li><li>Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems</li><li>Ability to work under pressure</li><li>Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members</li><li>Good understanding of project management principles<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications and Certifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent</li><li>Project management certification<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role</li><li>Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations</li><li>Good project administration and documentation experience</li><li>Report writing experience</li><li>Basic project management<br><br></li></ul><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>Position- </strong><strong>Sr Business Analyst</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location - </strong><strong>Chicago, IL </strong><strong>(</strong><strong>Hybrid 3 days in a week in an office</strong><strong>)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration -Full Time</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Good exposure in Financial domain, experience working in syndicate loans is huge plus</li><li>Engage with business users to define scope, understand business processes, problem statements and pain areas.</li><li>Identify key stakeholders and construct stakeholder analysis i.e., how they are affected.</li><li>Support the identification of risks and mitigation approaches.</li><li>Participate in client requirement workshops and identify gaps together with high level proposals for their resolution (e.g. development workarounds or change in processes). Ensure any solutions proposed are realistic and within the agreed scope of the project.</li><li>Analyze client business requirements, liaise with clients / project teams, and prepare business process documents like BRDs, User Stories, Discussion Logs, Workflows etc. Be involved actively in the process till the sign-off is not obtained from the client.</li><li>Participate in Solution design with the Design and Development team to ensure requirements are duly addressed. Ensure Requirement Traceability Matrix is updated to facilitate tracking of requirements coverage.</li><li>Having Good Requirement gathering skills and able to discuss &amp; finalize the wireframes &amp; draft the acceptance criteria with client.</li><li>Help conduct trainings to offshore team and onsite peers on domain topics and business understandings.</li></ul> Having Good communication &amp; client facing skills

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>Duration: </strong>2 months (with possible for extension)<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> One of our long-term Client is looking for a D365 developer for 6-8 weeks, with possible for extension. Task details as below:</li><li> Customize, configure, and test custom D365 Sales Module in UAT environment.</li><li> Develop custom forms, fields, and reports for leads and opportunities in D365 Sales.</li><li> Develop custom system views in leads and opportunities utilizing custom fields created.</li><li> Develop custom dashboards utilizing data to analyze success.</li><li> Apply business rules to fields to further automate process.</li><li> Import solution to Production environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skillset And Certifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5 years of D365 Development experience.</li><li> MS Power Platform Development experience, PL-900 Certification preferred.</li><li> MS Sales, MB-210 Certification preferred.</li></ul>

title: Kafka Cloud Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>As a Manager in the Forensic Technology Services team, the candidate will be responsible for driving the process of eDiscovery for our clients.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Responding directly to client requests and providing consultation within the framework of the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) including working closely with digital forensics and managed review teams </li><li> Developing, actively communicating, and managing project plans for clients including consultation on processes and tools to meet project goals </li><li> Executing against agreed to e-discovery protocols and regulatory processing and production requirements </li><li> Competency in end-to-end platform solutions, such as RelativityOne, including knowledge of processing workflows, early case assessment, review workflows, appropriate use and application of analytic tools and methodologies, machine translation workflows and complex production workflows </li><li> Proficiency and demonstrated experience in adopting, leveraging and applying advanced analytic applications such as H5 Matter Analytics, the Reveal Data suite (Reveal, NexLP and Brainspace) and the ever-evolving suite of technology </li><li> Be able to consult on technology assisted review applications and a basic understanding of algorithms and workflow with willingness to continue to develop this skillset </li><li> The ability to analyze and provide meaningful insights, interpretations and guidance by leveraging data intelligence and mining solutions (e.g. SmartSheet, Microsoft PowerBI, Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, trend analyses) to educate and consult with clients </li><li> Ability to manage multiple workstreams across the assigned portfolio of clients; including both upstream escalation paths and downstream day-to-day management </li><li> Staying on top of trends, new tools, and overall knowledge of the e-discovery marketplace in the service of our clients </li><li> Strong ability to translate highly technical information to non-technical clients </li><li> Exceptional organizational skills </li><li> Perform other related duties as required </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree, required </li><li> Juris Doctorate, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Five (5) or more years of e-discovery project experience, required </li><li> Experience in project management for e-discovery managed services, preferred </li><li> Experience with multi-matter repositories and migrating large quantities of data across workspaces and platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>License/Certifications</strong>  <ul><li> Two (2) or more Relativity certifications are strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Relativity Certified Administrator, preferred </li><li> RelativityOne Reviewer Pro, Relativity Analytics Specialist, and/or Relativity Project Management Specialist are strongly encouraged </li></ul><li> One (1) or more Reveal Data suite certifications strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Brainspace Analyst, Specialist, and/or Admin Certification, preferred </li><li> NexLP is a plus </li></ul><li> ACEDS' Certified E-Discovery Specialist Certification, eDiscovery Executive Certificate, and/or eDiscovery Technology Certificate is preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proficient in RelativityOne and Brainspace, required </li><li> Proficiency in H5, and a general understanding of machine language translation tools, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in other eDiscovery platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Strong analytical and critical thinking skills </li><li> Proven ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Solid organizational skills especially the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details and quality </li><li> Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment </li><li> Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and client personnel </li><li> Provide an encouraging team atmosphere on engagements and contribute to the professional development of the team </li><li> Foreign language skills, specifically in Mandarin, Cantonese, French, German, and/or Hindi is not required, but would be a strong benefit </li></ul><p><br></p>Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.<p><br></p>California Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p>Washington Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>BDO delivers assurance, tax, digital technology solutions and financial advisory services to clients throughout the country and around the globe. We offer numerous industry-specific practices, world-class resources, and an unparalleled commitment to meeting our clients‚Äô needs. We currently serve more than 400 publicly traded domestic and international clients.<p><br></p><ul><li>Unparalleled partner-involvement </li><li>Deep industry knowledge and participation</li><li>Geographic coverage across the U.S.</li><li>Cohesive global network </li><li>Focused capabilities across disciplines</li></ul><p><br></p>BDO brings world-class resources and exceptional service to each and every one of our clients. BDO USA is a member of BDO International, the world‚Äôs fifth largest accounting network.<p><br></p>BDO offers a competitive Total Rewards package that encompass so much more than ‚Äì ‚Äútraditional benefits‚Äù. Our wide range of rewards and our employees‚Äô ability to customize rewards to their individual needs are two of the reasons why BDO has been honored with so many workplace awards, including 100 Best Companies for Working Parents, Working Mother 100 Best Companies, Top Entry Level Employer, 2022 National Best &amp; Brightest Companies to Work For and more.<p><br></p><strong>Some Examples Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive pay and eligibility for an annual performance bonus. </li><li>A 401k plan plus an employer match</li><li>Comprehensive, medical, dental, vision, FSA, and prescription insurance from day one</li><li> Competitive Paid Time Off with daily accrual from day one of employment, plus paid holidays </li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Adoption Assistance</li><li>Firm paid life insurance</li><li>Wellness programs</li><li>Additional offerings include BDO Flex, Group Legal insurance, Pet insurance and Long-Term Care Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p>Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements.<p><br></p>Click here to find out more!<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.<p><br></p>BDO USA, LLP is an EO employer M/F/Veteran/Disability<p><br></p>
description_json: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>As a Manager in the Forensic Technology Services team, the candidate will be responsible for driving the process of eDiscovery for our clients.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Responding directly to client requests and providing consultation within the framework of the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) including working closely with digital forensics and managed review teams </li><li> Developing, actively communicating, and managing project plans for clients including consultation on processes and tools to meet project goals </li><li> Executing against agreed to e-discovery protocols and regulatory processing and production requirements </li><li> Competency in end-to-end platform solutions, such as RelativityOne, including knowledge of processing workflows, early case assessment, review workflows, appropriate use and application of analytic tools and methodologies, machine translation workflows and complex production workflows </li><li> Proficiency and demonstrated experience in adopting, leveraging and applying advanced analytic applications such as H5 Matter Analytics, the Reveal Data suite (Reveal, NexLP and Brainspace) and the ever-evolving suite of technology </li><li> Be able to consult on technology assisted review applications and a basic understanding of algorithms and workflow with willingness to continue to develop this skillset </li><li> The ability to analyze and provide meaningful insights, interpretations and guidance by leveraging data intelligence and mining solutions (e.g. SmartSheet, Microsoft PowerBI, Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, trend analyses) to educate and consult with clients </li><li> Ability to manage multiple workstreams across the assigned portfolio of clients; including both upstream escalation paths and downstream day-to-day management </li><li> Staying on top of trends, new tools, and overall knowledge of the e-discovery marketplace in the service of our clients </li><li> Strong ability to translate highly technical information to non-technical clients </li><li> Exceptional organizational skills </li><li> Perform other related duties as required </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree, required </li><li> Juris Doctorate, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Five (5) or more years of e-discovery project experience, required </li><li> Experience in project management for e-discovery managed services, preferred </li><li> Experience with multi-matter repositories and migrating large quantities of data across workspaces and platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>License/Certifications</strong>  <ul><li> Two (2) or more Relativity certifications are strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Relativity Certified Administrator, preferred </li><li> RelativityOne Reviewer Pro, Relativity Analytics Specialist, and/or Relativity Project Management Specialist are strongly encouraged </li></ul><li> One (1) or more Reveal Data suite certifications strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Brainspace Analyst, Specialist, and/or Admin Certification, preferred </li><li> NexLP is a plus </li></ul><li> ACEDS' Certified E-Discovery Specialist Certification, eDiscovery Executive Certificate, and/or eDiscovery Technology Certificate is preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proficient in RelativityOne and Brainspace, required </li><li> Proficiency in H5, and a general understanding of machine language translation tools, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in other eDiscovery platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Strong analytical and critical thinking skills </li><li> Proven ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Solid organizational skills especially the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details and quality </li><li> Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment </li><li> Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and client personnel </li><li> Provide an encouraging team atmosphere on engagements and contribute to the professional development of the team </li><li> Foreign language skills, specifically in Mandarin, Cantonese, French, German, and/or Hindi is not required, but would be a strong benefit </li></ul><p><br></p>Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.<p><br></p>California Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p>Washington Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>BDO delivers assurance, tax, digital technology solutions and financial advisory services to clients throughout the country and around the globe. We offer numerous industry-specific practices, world-class resources, and an unparalleled commitment to meeting our clients‚Äô needs. We currently serve more than 400 publicly traded domestic and international clients.<p><br></p><ul><li>Unparalleled partner-involvement </li><li>Deep industry knowledge and participation</li><li>Geographic coverage across the U.S.</li><li>Cohesive global network </li><li>Focused capabilities across disciplines</li></ul><p><br></p>BDO brings world-class resources and exceptional service to each and every one of our clients. Our wide range of rewards and our employees‚Äô ability to customize rewards to their individual needs are two of the reasons why BDO has been honored with so many workplace awards, including 100 Best Companies for Working Parents, Working Mother 100 Best Companies, Top Entry Level Employer, 2022 National Best &amp; Brightest Companies to Work For and more.<p><br></p><strong>Some Examples Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive pay and eligibility for an annual performance bonus. </li><li>A 401k plan plus an employer match</li><li>Comprehensive, medical, dental, vision, FSA, and prescription insurance from day one</li><li> Competitive Paid Time Off with daily accrual from day one of employment, plus paid holidays </li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Adoption Assistance</li><li>Firm paid life insurance</li><li>Wellness programs</li><li>Additional offerings include BDO Flex, Group Legal insurance, Pet insurance and Long-Term Care Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p>Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements.<p><br></p>Click here to find out more!<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.<p><br></p>BDO USA, LLP is an EO employer M/F/Veteran/Disability<p><br></p>

title: AEM Developer - REMOTE (22-00075)
description: <ul><li>Description:* Located in Woodridge, IL manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry.<br><br></li></ul>They are looking to add a Sr. Test Engineer to help Test Electronics during and post manufacturing.<br><br>This team develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that we build to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws. Focuses on manufacturing defects. Our means of doing that is to build a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. We work w the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement that. We control the software that we design and write the software to control instrumentation and the unit that we are testing.<br><ul><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* Labview, C#, Test Stand, SQL, Manufacturing Test, Test Automation, Test development, Test design, Test procedure, Hardware, Debug, Test Fixture, Production, Manufacturing, Lab, Validation, Test plan, Test engineering, Electrical, Test equipment, Write test scripts</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Labview</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:* 5+ years experience Labview Test Stand Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation -test fixtures/test stands; SQL or MySQL-don‚Äôt need to design schema, but come up with midlevel queries<br><br></li></ul>PLUS Automotive is a plus not required though. Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi)<br><br>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We‚Äôre supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description: <strong>Title: Python with Django Developer </strong><p><br></p><strong> Location: Full Remote- Chicago, IL </strong><p><br></p><strong> Duration: 12&amp;plus; months contract </strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Skillset</u></strong><p><br></p>Technical/Functional Skills Good Understanding of various Python libraries.<p><br></p>Hands on experience on python web frameworks like Django and Flask<p><br></p>Strong object oriented programming experience to include backend APIs, web-services like REST.<p><br></p>Experience with front end development tools (Javascript, HTML, CSS)<p><br></p>Experience writing scripts using PowerShell, Putty...etc for Applications automation.<p><br></p>Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.<p><br></p>Experience Required Hands on experience in core Python programming language.<p><br></p>Knowledge of Web services environments, languages, and formats, including RESTful APIs, HTML, JavaScript, XML, KML, SOAP, or JSON
