title: ETL Informatica Developer (Onsite)
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>As a Manager in the Forensic Technology Services team, the candidate will be responsible for driving the process of eDiscovery for our clients.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Responding directly to client requests and providing consultation within the framework of the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) including working closely with digital forensics and managed review teams </li><li> Developing, actively communicating, and managing project plans for clients including consultation on processes and tools to meet project goals </li><li> Executing against agreed to e-discovery protocols and regulatory processing and production requirements </li><li> Competency in end-to-end platform solutions, such as RelativityOne, including knowledge of processing workflows, early case assessment, review workflows, appropriate use and application of analytic tools and methodologies, machine translation workflows and complex production workflows </li><li> Proficiency and demonstrated experience in adopting, leveraging and applying advanced analytic applications such as H5 Matter Analytics, the Reveal Data suite (Reveal, NexLP and Brainspace) and the ever-evolving suite of technology </li><li> Be able to consult on technology assisted review applications and a basic understanding of algorithms and workflow with willingness to continue to develop this skillset </li><li> The ability to analyze and provide meaningful insights, interpretations and guidance by leveraging data intelligence and mining solutions (e.g. SmartSheet, Microsoft PowerBI, Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, trend analyses) to educate and consult with clients </li><li> Ability to manage multiple workstreams across the assigned portfolio of clients; including both upstream escalation paths and downstream day-to-day management </li><li> Staying on top of trends, new tools, and overall knowledge of the e-discovery marketplace in the service of our clients </li><li> Strong ability to translate highly technical information to non-technical clients </li><li> Exceptional organizational skills </li><li> Perform other related duties as required </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree, required </li><li> Juris Doctorate, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Five (5) or more years of e-discovery project experience, required </li><li> Experience in project management for e-discovery managed services, preferred </li><li> Experience with multi-matter repositories and migrating large quantities of data across workspaces and platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>License/Certifications</strong>  <ul><li> Two (2) or more Relativity certifications are strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Relativity Certified Administrator, preferred </li><li> RelativityOne Reviewer Pro, Relativity Analytics Specialist, and/or Relativity Project Management Specialist are strongly encouraged </li></ul><li> One (1) or more Reveal Data suite certifications strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Brainspace Analyst, Specialist, and/or Admin Certification, preferred </li><li> NexLP is a plus </li></ul><li> ACEDS' Certified E-Discovery Specialist Certification, eDiscovery Executive Certificate, and/or eDiscovery Technology Certificate is preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proficient in RelativityOne and Brainspace, required </li><li> Proficiency in H5, and a general understanding of machine language translation tools, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in other eDiscovery platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Strong analytical and critical thinking skills </li><li> Proven ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Solid organizational skills especially the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details and quality </li><li> Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment </li><li> Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and client personnel </li><li> Provide an encouraging team atmosphere on engagements and contribute to the professional development of the team </li><li> Foreign language skills, specifically in Mandarin, Cantonese, French, German, and/or Hindi is not required, but would be a strong benefit </li></ul><p><br></p>Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.<p><br></p>California Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p>Washington Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>BDO delivers assurance, tax, digital technology solutions and financial advisory services to clients throughout the country and around the globe. We offer numerous industry-specific practices, world-class resources, and an unparalleled commitment to meeting our clients‚Äô needs. We currently serve more than 400 publicly traded domestic and international clients.<p><br></p><ul><li>Unparalleled partner-involvement </li><li>Deep industry knowledge and participation</li><li>Geographic coverage across the U.S.</li><li>Cohesive global network </li><li>Focused capabilities across disciplines</li></ul><p><br></p>BDO brings world-class resources and exceptional service to each and every one of our clients. BDO USA is a member of BDO International, the world‚Äôs fifth largest accounting network.<p><br></p>BDO offers a competitive Total Rewards package that encompass so much more than ‚Äì ‚Äútraditional benefits‚Äù. Our wide range of rewards and our employees‚Äô ability to customize rewards to their individual needs are two of the reasons why BDO has been honored with so many workplace awards, including 100 Best Companies for Working Parents, Working Mother 100 Best Companies, Top Entry Level Employer, 2022 National Best &amp; Brightest Companies to Work For and more.<p><br></p><strong>Some Examples Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive pay and eligibility for an annual performance bonus. </li><li>A 401k plan plus an employer match</li><li>Comprehensive, medical, dental, vision, FSA, and prescription insurance from day one</li><li> Competitive Paid Time Off with daily accrual from day one of employment, plus paid holidays </li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Adoption Assistance</li><li>Firm paid life insurance</li><li>Wellness programs</li><li>Additional offerings include BDO Flex, Group Legal insurance, Pet insurance and Long-Term Care Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p>Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements.<p><br></p>Click here to find out more!<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.<p><br></p>BDO USA, LLP is an EO employer M/F/Veteran/Disability<p><br></p>

title: Microsoft Dynamics D365 Developer
description: <ul><li>LOOKING FOR A NEW LABVIEW OPPORTUNITY?</li><li>I have the one for YOU! My client manufactures Electronics and Telematics for the Automotive/Transportation industry. They are looking for a Tenured Test Engineer to help test the Electronics during and post manufacturing. You will be apart of the team that develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that is built to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects. You will be building a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. You will be working with the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement. You will control the software that you design and write the software to control instrumentation and the unit that we are testing.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* *</li><li>Labview - Top Skill*</li><li>C# - Or other Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL or MySQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Test procedure</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Debug</li><li>Test Fixture</li><li>Production</li><li>Manufacturing</li><li>Lab</li><li>Validation</li><li>Test plan</li><li>Test engineering</li><li>Electrical</li><li>Test equipment</li><li>Write test scripts</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Automotive is a plus but not required</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We‚Äôre supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Manager, eDiscovery Project Manager
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Old National Bank was established in 1834. Today, we are the largest financial services holding company with dual headquarters in Chicago and Evansville, IN. We provide an array of services to our clients which include Commercial and Community Banking, Investments, and Wealth Management. At Old National, we believe that by helping our team members balance work life with home life, we create a more productive workforce and a stronger company.<br><br>We are looking for an experienced and versatile technical business analyst to improve our information technology systems. This Technical Business Analyst will be a member of the Wealth Management IT team mapping business requirements to appropriate technical solutions across Old National Bank Wealth Management business line functions, as well as deliver solutions to meet an array of internal and customer facing systems. This individual will be responsible for documenting existing business needs and developing new and enhanced business processes to ensure IT solutions support and align with business initiatives. Offices based in either Chicago near Rosemont, Minneapolis/St Paul area or Evansville Indiana.<br><br><strong><u>Key Accountabilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Act as IT project lead to ensure all business requirements are captured for design, testing and implementation of a variety of solutions across corporate systems needs and capabilities. </li><li> Continually seek opportunities to increase client satisfaction, deepen relationships, and effectively manage client expectations. </li><li> Work with business sponsors to determine business requirements necessary to increase efficiency and functionality of software/applications. </li><li> Design current and future state processes and assist with connecting all necessary teams together to push project from start to finish </li><li> Design workflows, processes and solutions to solve business problems. </li><li> Ensure test strategies/plans involve appropriate integration and process components. </li><li> Develop unit test cases, system integration testing and validate test results during testing. </li><li> Build a strong cross functional understanding of both the company‚Äôs products and business operations. </li><li> basis </li><li> Clearly communicate complex technical solutions in a manner where business line can easily understand. </li><li> Exercise independent judgement and take the lead role on projects. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications And Education Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Extensive experience in technical business analysis in Wealth Management or Financial Services industry is required. </li><li> Strong verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Ability to travel and stay overnight as needed. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Key Measures Of Success/Key Deliverables<br></u></strong><ul><li> Demonstrates the ability to effectively prepare and maintain the following documents and tools: </li><li> Business Process </li><li> Process Flow Analysis </li><li> Functional Design </li><li> Requirements Definition </li><li> Project Plans </li><li> Demonstrates the following Leadership skills: </li><li> Monitors progress and follow-ups. </li><li> Provides respectful feedback. </li><li> Escalates where necessary. </li><li> Delivers projects on time. <br></li></ul>We continually seek highly motivated and talented individuals. Our people are critical to the Bank's strategy and success. In return we offer competitive compensation with our salary, structured bonus program, exceptional medical, dental, vision insurance, 5% company contribution on 401K, continuing education and a unique opportunity with a growing, client-focused and collegial company.<br><br><strong> Old National is proud to be an equal opportunity employer focused on fostering an inclusive workplace and committed to hiring a workforce comprised of diverse backgrounds, cultures and thinking styles. <br><br></strong>As such, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>We do not accept resumes from external staffing agencies or independent recruiters for any of our openings unless we have an agreement signed by the Head of Talent Acquisition, SVP, to fill a specific position.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong><u>Must Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Experience in JIRA system to track, manage and deliver the business requirements throughout SDLC</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge And/or Prior Experience In SAP Applications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Analyze current cross functional business processes and make recommendations for improvement based on industry trends and professional business knowledge</li><li> Analyze gaps in requirements and business processes between the AS-IS and TO-BE state of systems</li><li> Perform requirement elicitation, gathering and documentation throughout SDLC lifecycle.</li><li> Document business requirements, system requirements, functional/non-functional requirements, and data mapping requirements specifications.</li><li> Develop UML diagrams to depict workflows</li><li> Document customer/user journey maps and assessing pain points</li><li> Create requirement documentation templates as per the nature of the project.</li><li> Prepare Requirements Traceability Matrices (RTM), and GAP Analysis documents.</li><li> Perform requirement review sessions with impacted Stakeholders and attain approval/sign off.</li><li> Communicate requirements to the leadership, development, and quality assurance teams.</li><li> Identify, communicate, and manage risks with business stakeholders, leadership/management, and development teams.</li><li> Work directly with clients to understand the individual needs of the business</li><li> Design and implement intermediate SQL queries for testing, reporting and data validation</li></ul>

title: ServiceNow Solutions Engineer - ITSM (C)
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>As a Manager in the Forensic Technology Services team, the candidate will be responsible for driving the process of eDiscovery for our clients.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Responding directly to client requests and providing consultation within the framework of the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) including working closely with digital forensics and managed review teams </li><li> Developing, actively communicating, and managing project plans for clients including consultation on processes and tools to meet project goals </li><li> Executing against agreed to e-discovery protocols and regulatory processing and production requirements </li><li> Competency in end-to-end platform solutions, such as RelativityOne, including knowledge of processing workflows, early case assessment, review workflows, appropriate use and application of analytic tools and methodologies, machine translation workflows and complex production workflows </li><li> Proficiency and demonstrated experience in adopting, leveraging and applying advanced analytic applications such as H5 Matter Analytics, the Reveal Data suite (Reveal, NexLP and Brainspace) and the ever-evolving suite of technology </li><li> Be able to consult on technology assisted review applications and a basic understanding of algorithms and workflow with willingness to continue to develop this skillset </li><li> The ability to analyze and provide meaningful insights, interpretations and guidance by leveraging data intelligence and mining solutions (e.g. SmartSheet, Microsoft PowerBI, Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, trend analyses) to educate and consult with clients </li><li> Ability to manage multiple workstreams across the assigned portfolio of clients; including both upstream escalation paths and downstream day-to-day management </li><li> Staying on top of trends, new tools, and overall knowledge of the e-discovery marketplace in the service of our clients </li><li> Strong ability to translate highly technical information to non-technical clients </li><li> Exceptional organizational skills </li><li> Perform other related duties as required </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree, required </li><li> Juris Doctorate, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Five (5) or more years of e-discovery project experience, required </li><li> Experience in project management for e-discovery managed services, preferred </li><li> Experience with multi-matter repositories and migrating large quantities of data across workspaces and platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>License/Certifications</strong>  <ul><li> Two (2) or more Relativity certifications are strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Relativity Certified Administrator, preferred </li><li> RelativityOne Reviewer Pro, Relativity Analytics Specialist, and/or Relativity Project Management Specialist are strongly encouraged </li></ul><li> One (1) or more Reveal Data suite certifications strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Brainspace Analyst, Specialist, and/or Admin Certification, preferred </li><li> NexLP is a plus </li></ul><li> ACEDS' Certified E-Discovery Specialist Certification, eDiscovery Executive Certificate, and/or eDiscovery Technology Certificate is preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proficient in RelativityOne and Brainspace, required </li><li> Proficiency in H5, and a general understanding of machine language translation tools, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in other eDiscovery platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Strong analytical and critical thinking skills </li><li> Proven ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Solid organizational skills especially the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details and quality </li><li> Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment </li><li> Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and client personnel </li><li> Provide an encouraging team atmosphere on engagements and contribute to the professional development of the team </li><li> Foreign language skills, specifically in Mandarin, Cantonese, French, German, and/or Hindi is not required, but would be a strong benefit </li></ul><p><br></p>Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.<p><br></p>California Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p>Washington Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>BDO delivers assurance, tax, digital technology solutions and financial advisory services to clients throughout the country and around the globe. We offer numerous industry-specific practices, world-class resources, and an unparalleled commitment to meeting our clients‚Äô needs. We currently serve more than 400 publicly traded domestic and international clients.<p><br></p><ul><li>Unparalleled partner-involvement </li><li>Deep industry knowledge and participation</li><li>Geographic coverage across the U.S.</li><li>Cohesive global network </li><li>Focused capabilities across disciplines</li></ul><p><br></p>BDO brings world-class resources and exceptional service to each and every one of our clients. BDO USA is a member of BDO International, the world‚Äôs fifth largest accounting network.<p><br></p>BDO offers a competitive Total Rewards package that encompass so much more than ‚Äì ‚Äútraditional benefits‚Äù. Our wide range of rewards and our employees‚Äô ability to customize rewards to their individual needs are two of the reasons why BDO has been honored with so many workplace awards, including 100 Best Companies for Working Parents, Working Mother 100 Best Companies, Top Entry Level Employer, 2022 National Best &amp; Brightest Companies to Work For and more.<p><br></p><strong>Some Examples Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive pay and eligibility for an annual performance bonus. </li><li>A 401k plan plus an employer match</li><li>Comprehensive, medical, dental, vision, FSA, and prescription insurance from day one</li><li> Competitive Paid Time Off with daily accrual from day one of employment, plus paid holidays </li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Adoption Assistance</li><li>Firm paid life insurance</li><li>Wellness programs</li><li>Additional offerings include BDO Flex, Group Legal insurance, Pet insurance and Long-Term Care Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p>Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements.<p><br></p>Click here to find out more!<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.<p><br></p>BDO USA, LLP is an EO employer M/F/Veteran/Disability<p><br></p>

title: Test Engineer
description: We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.<br><br>The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.<br><br>This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.<br><br>What you will do<br><ul><li>Design, implement and document system level Go code</li><li>Model data, design database schemas and implement data storage in a dqlite (SQL) database</li><li>Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system tests</li><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions</li><li>Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external events<br><br></li></ul>Who you are<br><ul><li>You have experience programming in Go and C</li><li>You are knowledgeable in networking and storage technologies</li><li>You have experience with two or more of: cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community</li><li>You are curious, flexible, articulate and accountable</li><li>You value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivated</li><li>You have a bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree<br><br></li></ul>Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.<br><br>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<br><br>#Stack<br><br>

They specialise in delivering innovative .NET technology based business solutions to investment banks, financial services companies, prestigious music/media label and many more. They are about to embark on one of the most ambitious .NET development projects since the birth of the .NET framework.<p><br></p>We are seeking several .NET Software Engineer with an extensive array of talent and expertise. .NET Software Engineer will be given complete ownership of your business area and the opportunity to work on the full project life cycle. .NET Software Engineer applicants should have a skill set that encompasses some or all of the following: .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. title: Manager, eDiscovery Project Manager
description: For over 30 years, Rewards Network has helped restaurants increase their revenue, traffic, and customer engagement through our innovative financial and marketing services and premier dining rewards programs. We connect diners to fantastic restaurant experiences by offering unique card-linked offers thanks to our ability to leverage advanced technology and powerful data analytics, while simultaneously providing value to our strategic partners' overall loyalty programs.<br><br>We work alongside our restaurant partners every day, sharing in the ebbs and flows of their business while helping them achieve their dreams. We provide marketing and financing that work with their business and are truly pay-for-performance. We help them increase revenue, traffic, and customer engagement. Importantly, our services do not require the merchant to discount or give away their products.<br><br>Even more, we enhance our partners' loyalty programs by offering a turn-key, scalable dining rewards program that is right for their business model and leverages their unique brand to help increase the value proposition for their customers.<br><br>Finally, we connect our millions of members to our participating restaurants, allowing them to earn the rewards they desire when dining out.<br><br>Rewards Network (RN) is seeking a Scala Software Engineer to work with a team of peers to build out new business areas and improve our rewards platform. As a member of the team, you will work closely with other software engineers, product owner, and stakeholders to design and develop our core rewards engine and all the supporting applications. We are looking for a passionate problem solver that is highly focused, agile, and who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative and team-centric environment using the latest technologies.<br><br><strong><u>What You‚Äôll Be Working With<br></u></strong><ul><li>Underlying architecture: Kubernetes, Docker, Immutable infrastructure </li><li>Technologies: Scala, Cats, FS2, Kafka, Postgres SQL, Elastic Search, Kibana, AWS S3</li><li>Tools: Gitlab (VCS/CI), Team City, Postman, Slack, Jira<br></li></ul><strong><u>Duties And Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Work with a team of peers to architect, design and implement our new platform and supporting applications in the latest technologies. </li><li>Apply technology to strategically solve business challenges.</li><li>Identify, research and implement new technologies that improve efficiency, responsiveness, resiliency, and/or ease of development.</li><li>Actively participate in and help evolve all adopted Agile/Lean/Kanban practices such as: TDD (Test Driven Development), BDD (Behavior Driven Development), stand-ups, retrospectives, continuous delivery, and knowledge sharing across team members.</li><li>Aggressively and proactively test software throughout the development cycle using a TDD mindset - including unit testing, functional testing, load testing and automation.</li><li>Collaborate with Quality Assurance engineers in test case construction, issue identification, as well as remediation and automation.</li><li>Continuously improve, refine, and refactor software.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Haves<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS in Computer Science, boot camp or equivalent experience</li><li>2+ years of general development experience</li><li>1+ years of development using Scala or other functional languages</li><li>1+ years of experience on an Agile delivery team </li><li>Understand, articulate, and conform to core functional and OOP programming principles.</li><li>Experience with relational databases </li><li>Experience working with and designing RESTful and/or event-driven microservice architectures</li><li>Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery using Git, Team City or similar tools</li><li>A commitment to developing solid, tested, high performing valuable software </li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to collaborate with a wide variety of people with varying technical skill sets and business knowledge</li><li>Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Must be able to quickly assess problems and determine proper steps to resolution. </li><li>Nice to Haves: </li><li>Ability to break down large projects into individual stories and MVPs (Minimum Viable Products)</li><li>Experience developing or maintaining automated test suites or tools<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We Offer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Comprehensive benefits package, which includes:</li><li>Competitive Paid Time Off and company holidays</li><li>Generous dining reimbursement when you dine with our restaurant clients </li><li>401(k) plan with a company match</li><li>Two medical plan options- Standard PPO or High Deductible Health Plan (HSA with company match for HDHP participants)</li><li>Partnership with Rx n Go, offering certain prescriptions for free</li><li>Two dental plan options and a vision plan</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts and a pre-tax commuter benefit program</li><li>Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity Insurance Plans</li><li>Short Term and Long Term disability </li><li>Company-paid life insurance and AD&amp;D insurance, supplemental employee, spouse, and child life insurance </li><li>Employee Life Assistance Program<br></li></ul><em>Rewards Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We encourage and strongly support workplace diversity.</em>

including unit testing, functional testing, load testing and automation.</li><li>Collaborate with Quality Assurance engineers in test case construction, issue identification, as well as remediation and automation.</li><li>Continuously improve, refine, and refactor software.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Haves<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS in Computer Science, boot camp or equivalent experience</li><li>2+ years of general development experience</li><li>1+ years of development using Scala or other functional languages</li><li>1+ years of experience on an Agile delivery team </li><li>Understand, articulate, and conform to core functional and OOP programming principles.</li><li>Experience with relational databases </li><li>Experience working with and designing RESTful and/or event-driven microservice architectures</li><li>Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery using Git, Team City or similar tools</li><li>A commitment to developing solid, tested, high performing valuable software </li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to collaborate with a wide variety of people with varying technical skill sets and business knowledge</li><li>Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Must be able to quickly assess problems and determine proper steps to resolution. </li><li>Nice to Haves: </li><li>Ability to break down large projects into individual stories and MVPs (Minimum Viable Products)</li><li>Experience developing or maintaining automated test suites or tools<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We Offer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Comprehensive benefits package, which includes:</li><li>Competitive Paid Time Off and company holidays</li><li>Generous dining reimbursement when you dine with our restaurant clients </li><li>401(k) plan with a company match</li><li>Two medical plan options- Standard PPO or High Deductible Health Plan (HSA with company match for HDHP participants)</li><li>Partnership with Rx n Go, offering certain prescriptions for free</li><li>Two dental plan options and a vision plan</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts and a pre-tax commuter benefit program</li><li>Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity Insurance Plans</li><li>Short Term and Long Term disability </li><li>Company-paid life insurance and AD&amp;D insurance, supplemental employee, spouse, and child life insurance </li><li>Employee Life Assistance Program<br></li></ul><em>Rewards Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We encourage and strongly support workplace diversity.</em>

title: CNC Programmer
description: <strong>Title:</strong> Sr. Model Implementation Developer<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, Illinois - Hybrid, 3 days onsite<p><br></p><strong>Duration &amp; Type:</strong> Direct Hire<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong> Competitive Salary, Access to Healthcare, Vision and Dental Insurance Plan of Choice and 401K Plan<p><br></p>Chamberlain Advisors is currently seeking a Sr. Model Implementation Developer, for our client in the financial services industry. This is a Direct Hire position. The Sr. Model Implementation Developer will be responsible for supporting MRM‚Äôs engagement with the company‚Äôs Renaissance initiative, a firmwide development project. You will provide support for the review and signoff of the Renaissance Risk Pillar test plans and test results. The goal is also to support the development of MRM‚Äôs independent verification testing capabilities for the Risk Pillar. This will include creating MRM‚Äôs independent implementation of the company‚Äôs financial risk models. You should be able to solve problems creatively, communicate effectively, and proactively, engage in technical decision making to achieve these objectives. This individual will be a team player who can easily work well with business, technical and non-technical professionals, in an Agile environment. Click apply now and join the Chamberlain experience.<p><br></p><strong><u>Ideal Candidate Profile</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be a self-starter, independent and comfortable with a fast paced, dynamic environment. </li><li>A team player who assists the team as required to achieve collective goals &amp; delivery milestones including knowledge-share. </li></ul> <strong>What You Will Be Accountable For:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Review and signoff of test plans and results for Risk Pillar of the company‚Äôs Renaissance Initiative. </li><li>Maintenance of MRM‚Äôs custom Risk Systems Control Tool. This includes the development and delivery of business features in the application‚Äôs front end, middle layer, and back end. </li><li>Deployment for MVG‚Äôs Risk System Control Tool in an AWS environment to facilitate MRM‚Äôs Renaissance testing activities. Inclusive of integration with AWS data sources. </li><li>Development of the companies‚Äô quantitative financial models into MRM‚Äôs modeling infrastructure with focus on computational performance. </li><li>Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects while assisting with continuous improvement, Emphasis on clean coding standards. </li><li>Actively participates in creation and review of both business and technical user stories, providing constructive feedback and input on both work effort estimation as well as architecture/design improvements. </li><li>Participate in innovative design, proof of concept(s) with emerging technologies and solutions. </li><li>Embrace industry best practices like continuous integration, continuous deployment, automated testing, TDD etc. </li><li>Will write unit and integration tests, based on chosen DevOps frameworks. </li><li>Maintain the MRM IT infrastructure, such as the collection of servers, data bases, and management of share drives. </li></ul> <strong>What Qualifications You Need:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science, or similar technical field required. Masters preferred. </li><li>7+ years .NET and C# development experience. </li><li>5+ years of JavaScript experience, including React and typescript. </li><li>2+ years working in Cloud environment. </li><li>2+ years Java development. </li><li>3+ years developing quantitative financial models. </li><li>Experience as architect for both front-end and back-end solutions. </li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs. </li><li>Experience following Git workflows. </li><li>Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. </li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, Elasticsearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. </li><li>Experience with financial data. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why Work with Chamberlain?</strong><p><br></p>Chamberlain Advisors is a veteran-owned business that provides human capital solutions through contract, contract-to-hire, direct-hire, and retained-search opportunities. Chamberlain candidates benefit from our unique hiring and interviewing process which has been designed to increase the likelihood that they will be successful in their job searches. This is achieved through our 5-step recruitment process, ensuring a top-of-the-line candidate experience. Find out what makes us different; apply to Chamberlain today.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Opportunity Employer</strong><p><br></p>Chamberlain Advisors provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Chamberlain Advisors complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Chamberlain Advisors expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Chamberlain Advisors' employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.<p><br></p>

title: Junior Java Developer
description: Job Posting Title: Android Developer<p><br></p>Location : CHICAGO IL<p><br></p>Onsite<p><br></p>Description:<p><br></p>Design and develop software applications (apps) for mobile phones, Smartphones, tablets, and other mobile devices. May develop on one or more mobile platforms including Apple iOS, BlackBerry, Google Android, Microsoft Windows Mobile, and/or other mobile platforms. Manage full software development life cycle including testing, implementation, and auditing. Perform product design, bug verification, and beta support which may require research and analysis. Job Summary: Create, maintain and implement the source code to develop mobile apps and programs that meet the needs and requirements of the clients using the computer programming languages. Primary Responsibilities: Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support); Produce fully functional mobile applications writing clean code; Gather specific requirements and suggest solutions; Write unit and UI tests to identify malfunctions; Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance; Design interfaces to improve user experience; Liaise with Product development team to plan new features; Ensure new and legacy applications meet quality standards; Research and suggest new mobile products, applications and protocols; Stay up-to-date with new technology trends. Qualifications: Proven work experience as a Mobile developer; Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market; In-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Swift and Java; Experience with third-party libraries and APIs.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with the eCommerce team and IT to prepare and program various projects related to the latest Mobile technologies</li><li>Deliver across the entire app life cycle from concept, design, build, deploy, test, and support</li><li>Follow MVVM and Clean architecture design patterns</li><li>Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability and general reliability</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>Experience working with GIT VCS</li><li>Possess a deep knowledge of Android application development</li><li>Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON, third party libraries and APIs</li><li>Perform peer‚Äôs code review to make sure they are following correct practices and standards</li><li>Lead small projects and provide appropriate timelines for project completion</li><li>Ability to creatively architect and design programs to meet the goals and requirements of various projects</li><li>Quickly integrate and update projects</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing project tasks on schedule and by interacting with other developers</li><li>Provide technical insight on existing mobile platforms to improve performance, availability and utilization optimizations</li><li>Performs research and development to evaluate emerging technologies and their potential to optimize the platform</li><li>Evaluate, suggest and implement third party software as needed</li><li>Make efficient use of source control and bug tracking systems Reviews estimates for software development and delivery to ensure quality and accuracy</li></ul><p><br></p>Knowledge/Skills<p><br></p><strong>Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Android studio, Java, Kotlin, Android SDK, and SQLite, JetPack(i.e: ViewModel, Live data, Room‚Ä¶)</li><li>Experience working with third party networking libraries such as Retrofit</li><li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Able to manage multiple priorities and deliverables, both short and long-term, in a busy and aggressive environment</li><li>Must be self-motivated, possess strong communication skills and be able to work in a team-oriented environment</li><li>Knowledge in GitHub VCS</li><li>Testing code with AndroidX Test</li><li>Knowledge in Jira</li><li>Ability to code a feature using clean architecture with MVVM</li><li>Must be able to debug issues</li><li>Deep knowledge of Activity, Fragment, Service, Broadcast receiver, Intent, Content provider</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Analytic tools such as Google Analytics, New Relic.</li><li>Gradle; FCM; AR; AI/ML; Google play services; Widgets, Groovy</li><li>App profiling tools; instrumentation tools</li><li>Knowledge in Google Material design specs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p>Required<p><br></p><ul><li>8 or more years of experience in application design, development, installation and modification of software</li><li>5+ years of experience with Android application development</li><li>Experience developing native Android Apps with Kotlin, Java, Android SDK using Android Studio</li></ul><p><br></p>Education<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Management Information Systems and/or equivalent work experience</li></ul> Android Developer -Direct client Hybrid (A)<p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>Sports Betting Company Looking For a Front End Developer</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by: Caitlin Johnson<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary: $90,000 - $150,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A bit about us:</strong><p><br></p>We are pushing the boundaries of AI. An exciting new AI company founded with the goal of democratizing state-of-the-art AI. The AI Acceleration Platform optimizes the biggest ML models to be smaller, faster, and cheaper so companies can easily access and scale towards the best performance. Imagine a day where large language models like T5 or GPT-3 are used everywhere - that's our vision. We are a team of ML engineers and researchers helping make ML more effective by implementing and advancing the latest research in AI for AI and hardware-software optimizations.<p><br></p>We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p>We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Computer Science degree or qualification in a related field</li><li> Minimum 2 years of experience related to this role</li><li> Solid experience in Javascript/HTML/CSS including ReactJS and NodeJS</li><li> Experience in NoSQL, REST and microservices architecture</li><li> Proficiency in written and spoken English</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop clean web interactions using React</li><li> Create and maintain API endpoints integrated with the system</li><li> Help design and build the tech stack to ensure high system scalability and reliability</li><li> Manage specification, development, testing and releasing of new features</li></ul><p><br></p>You Are a Good Fit If You Have<p><br></p><ul><li> Extensive experience in designing, developing, or maintaining scalable web services</li><li> Experience working on large-scale systems and enterprise software</li><li> Expertise in application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines</li><li> Familiarity with CI/CD tools and deployment processes</li><li> Understanding best practices and current trends.</li></ul><p><br></p>Strong Pluses<p><br></p><ul><li> Past experience working at a SaaS company</li><li> Experience working with Amazon Web Services</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: .NET Software Engineer ‚Äì Chicago
description: <ul><li>READY TO DO YOUR PART AND HELP PROTECT OUR TROOPS?* I have the position for you! My client is currently hiring for an Embedded Software Engineer to develop products to help protect our troops. In this position you will be working with Embedded C/C++ within VxWorks operating systems for software development. This position requires you to be doing both Embedded C development along with C++ Object Oriented Programming with some being OOD development, design patterns, and deeper OO concepts. title: .NET Software Engineer ‚Äì Chicago
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>S&amp;C Electronics, a global leader for power reliability products is looking for a Software Project Engineer. Included in this position is the support of intelligent embedded software devices including microprocessor-based switch and fault interrupting controls. Candidates must have a strong background in design and development of embedded software on custom electronics.<br><br>This position can be remote (located in the United States) or on-site/hybrid at one of our office locations (Chicago, Alameda, or Franklin). Occasional travel to (10%) to one of these locations may be required for development, system integration/testing, and debugging. In this position, you will report to the Senior Manager ‚Äì Embedded Firmware in Chicago.<br><br><strong>The work associated with this position includes, but is not limited to, the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Design embedded application firmware for microprocessor-based fault interrupting controls.</li><li>Contribute to the development of architecture design, software specifications, project schedules, task and project completion time estimates, and test plans.</li><li>Develop embedded C/C++ firmware for low power designs, including hardware device drivers.</li><li>Develop and support PC-based engineering test tools as needed.</li><li>Create, execute, and automate Unit Tests.</li><li>Review and implement product requirements.</li><li>Participate in Agile scrum meetings and peer reviews of source code.</li><li>Investigate new technologies and create design documents as necessary.</li><li>Collaborate with hardware and test engineers to support verification and validation of products at the module level and system level.</li><li>Work with product management and field services to resolve firmware-related customer issues. <br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Being a team player is essential.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Technical leadership abilities with good interpersonal skills.</li><li>Continuous learner and self-starter.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of programming principles in C/C++ and Python.</li><li>Familiarity with real-time operation and low power microprocessor modes.</li><li>Embedded software development experience with and without an operating system.</li><li>Experience with digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers.</li><li>Experience working with and writing drivers for common peripherals and interconnects, such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, DAC, UART, DMA, flash memory.</li><li>Experience with configuration management/process tools: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket/Git.</li><li>Experience in one or more of the following areas is preferred: electric grid automation and/or control for utility applications, peer-to-peer communications techniques, wired and wireless communications experience (Ethernet, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi). </li><li>Experience with signal processing (FFT, DFT, waveform analysis) and actuator/motor control is a plus.</li><li>Experience with Jenkins and Docker is a plus.</li><li>Experience with embedded Linux, Zephyr, or other real time operating systems is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Relevant Experience Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>5-7 years of experience developing C/C++ firmware applications and device drivers for low power designs. <br></li></ul><strong>MAJOR PHYSICAL DEMANDS<br></strong><ul><li>Standing: Occasional standing for work on complete control assemblies.</li><li>Lifting: Occasional lifting of controls and test equipment, less than 50 pounds.</li><li>Walking: Occasional walking throughout the facility.</li><li>Carrying: Occasional carrying of light objects.</li><li>Pushing: Infrequent pushing of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Pulling: Infrequent pulling of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Bending: Occasional bending during access to equipment.</li><li>Reaching: Infrequent reaching.</li><li>Handling: Frequent handling of parts or tools.</li><li>Environment: Frequent handling of parts or tools.<br></li></ul><strong>S &amp; C - TOP WORKPLACE<br></strong><ul><li>For 2019, S &amp; C Electric Company was named the 10th-best place to work among large employers in the Chicagoland area by The Chicago Tribune as part of the newspaper's prestigious annual Top Workplaces list.</li><li>For 2020, S &amp; C Electric was named as the 15th-Best Workplace in Chicago Tribune‚Äôs 11th Annual Report.</li><li>For 2021, S &amp; C Electric was named Among Top 2021 Workplaces in the United States by Top Workplaces USA, the nation‚Äôs most credible employer-recognition program.<br></li></ul>
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Utilities

innovation.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities:<br><br></strong>Develop high-quality, responsive web applications using modern frontend technologies, including ReactJS and TypeScript.<br><br>Collaborate with scientific software developers to translate UI/UX wireframes and mockups into fully functional web applications.<br><br>Implement and maintain frontend architectures, ensuring scalability and performance optimization.<br><br>Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code.<br><br>Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the highest level of quality and usability.<br><br>Stay up JavaScript/TypeScript, and related frontend frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).<br><br>Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and frontend build tools (e.g., description: *Position is Bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a DevOps Kubernetes Engineer. Candidate will be joining the DevOps team and supporting the development efforts for a team that strives for goals that refine and automate the processes needed to support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support Terraform, Ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of Kanban and/or Agile methodologies</li><li>Able to succeed in fast-paced environment with frequent changes</li><li>Comfortable communicating with both technical and non-technical audiences</li><li>Self-starter - takes the initiative to research, learn and deliver</li><li>Team player - humble, collaborative, and focused on making sure the entire team succeeds</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li></ul>

GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li></ul>

title: Sr. Model Implementation Developer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Project Manager/Business Analyst ‚Äì Chicago<br><br></strong><strong><u>Company Description<br><br></u></strong>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<br><br>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<br><br>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<br><br><strong>The Role<br><br></strong>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for an experienced Project Manager/Business Analyst (PM/BA) as we continue to grow our Chicago-based practice. We are looking for people with aptitude, intelligence, and desire as this role is the primary point of contact with the client. This role will require effective communication and the ability to focus on high quality work under pressure in leading technical and non-technical audiences. The successful candidate will work directly with clients and internal staff to estimate, plan and manage projects to successful completion.<br><br>Our solution offerings include custom design, integrated solutions that leverage third-party software and COTS products, and highly configurable, low code case management solutions that that incorporate leading-edge technologies. These include cloud-based mobility, data analytics and visualizations, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.<br><br>As a Project Manager/Business Analyst, you will work in a collaborative environment within our project teams where you will track, manage and report upon scope, schedule, budget for client projects. This PM/BA role, frequent and clear communication is necessary to establish productive and balanced relationships with customer stakeholders and sponsors.<br><br>You will participate in project planning and assessment engagements where you will work closely with our customers to present and document options, recommendations, and roadmaps to support their long-term planning and strategy.<br><br>You will also work in a collaborative environment where you will play a key role in obtaining requirements from clients, lead and take part in JAD sessions and work with internal and external stakeholders.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Create, update, and manage project schedule using Microsoft Project or other client-approved software.</li><li>Control and manage project scope, budget, activities, and expectations to ensure profitability of RedMane projects.</li><li>Regularly track, report, and analyze project status, including scheduling and conducting regular status meetings, and creating client-facing status reports.</li><li>Create and manage Risk, Change and Issues registers for the project.</li><li>Plan, schedule and manage project activities with clients.</li><li>Regularly manage, interact, and collaborate with RedMane project team members.</li><li>Plan and lead Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions</li><li>Ability to lead design sessions and workshops with clients to capture functional requirements.</li><li>Facilitate discussions and resolution of project-related issues and blockers if they arise.</li><li>Create monthly reports and forecasts to RedMane executive management of project status, schedule, milestones, and budget.</li><li>Facilitate, schedule, and plan Executive Steering Committee meetings for projects ‚Äì including creation of presentations and other material to effectively communicate project progress.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements<br><br></u></strong>The PM/BA candidate will need to have:<br><ul><li>7 years of project management and/or business analysis experience with increasing scope of responsibility.</li><li>Experience in crafting project proposals, developing work estimates and project schedules.</li><li>Experience in project planning and control of multi-year and multi-phase projects.</li><li>Experience with the identification and mitigation of project risk.</li><li>Proficiency with project management tools and software (e.g., Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint).</li><li>Strong interpersonal and management skills with an excellent attention to detail.</li><li>Experience managing projects involving data analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT is a plus, but not required.</li><li>PMP certification is a plus, but not required.<br></li></ul>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:<br><ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.</li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Travel Requirements<br><br></u></strong>The position may involve periodic travel to client locations within the US.<br><br><strong>We Offer You<br><br></strong>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<br><br><strong><u>RedMane Is Very Proud To Offer Employees Professional And Personal Perks That Include<br><br></u></strong>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<br><ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week. </li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.</li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.</li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5ks to triathlons.</li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Project Manager, PMP, Business Analyst, requirements, budget, JAD session, risk management, scope, agile, PM, BA, project schedule

Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<br><br><strong><u>RedMane Is Very Proud To Offer Employees Professional And Personal Perks That Include<br><br></u></strong>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<br><ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week. </li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.</li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.</li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5ks to triathlons.</li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Project Manager, PMP, Business Analyst, requirements, budget, JAD session, risk management, scope, agile, PM, BA, project schedule

(iPad) </li><li>Work under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst and alongside a professional team in a collaborative environment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide structured 1:1 interaction &amp; instruction to children on the autism spectrum &amp; other related disorders by providing in-home or community-setting Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy. </li><li>Collect &amp; provide observational data on the learning process. </li><li>Implement Behavior Treatment Plans. (daily living, social, &amp; play schemes) </li><li>Work collaboratively with BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) &amp; alongside a professional team to implement an individualized treatment plan for clients. </li><li>Document client progress &amp; graph data as instructed. </li><li>Enter electronic data collection promptly &amp; with accuracy. </li><li>Be responsive to the needs &amp; requests of clients, their families, &amp; your supervisor.</li><li>Be goal-oriented &amp; maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work. </li><li>Arrive on time &amp; be prepared for therapy sessions. </li><li>Commit to &amp; follow a weekly schedule with clients. </li><li>Willingness &amp; ability to adapt to a variety of situations and changing behaviors. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>No experienced required. (minimum) </li><li>Pass background checks &amp; Drug Screening. </li><li>Complete the 40-hour training course. </li><li>Reliable transportation &amp; willingness to travel. </li><li>Compassionate, loving, and excellent communication skills. (both verbal and non-verbal) </li><li>Excellent work ethic with the ability to meet scheduling commitments. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive pay is $18 - $22 based on ABA experience. </li><li>Placement within proximity to your home. </li><li>A rewarding career helping children with AD reach their potential. </li><li>Development in the field of ABA. </li><li>A flexible part-time schedule. </li><li>Best-in-class training program. title: Software Project Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs‚Äîso you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States</li><li>SALARY: $125,000 ‚Äì $160,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Required Qualifications <br></strong><ul><li>5+ years technical software experience </li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages such as PHP</li><li>Proficiency with database technology such as SQL Server and MySQL</li><li>Database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions</li><li>Strong understanding of software architecture, data structures, and computer science fundamentals </li><li>Strong security background (comfortable working with PII/sensitive data)</li><li>Experience with agile and fast-paced software development methodologies </li><li>Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills</li><li>Good problem-solving skills</li><li>Attention to detail<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior experience working and communicating directly with clients</li><li>Laravel and Node.js experience helpful</li><li>Familiarity with CSS preprocessors, bundlers, and associated languages/syntaxes/libraries (e.g., Sass, Less, and webpack)</li><li>An eye for design and user experience</li><li>Technical literacy and hands-on experience across the software stack, infrastructure, and dev-ops</li><li>Knowledge of Enterprise HR systems (WorkDay, SuccessFactors, Oracle, SAP)</li><li>Proficiency with Git</li><li>Appreciation for clean and well documented code</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you‚Äôll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be working on the design, architecture, development, and innovation of customized HR software for some of the world‚Äôs most sophisticated companies. You will use PHP, SQL, JavaScript, and CSS to deploy software quickly to meet their needs. Our work is fast-paced, creative, and flexible‚Äìyour days will be too! You will spend time problem solving with clients live, helping them see the range of what‚Äôs possible, building what they need, and working directly with HR experts. You will work alongside client team-members and thrive on the responsibility to own large projects from conceptualization to sunset.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Build the software development process from conception to deployment </li><li>Maintaining and upgrading the software following deployment </li><li>Managing the end-to-end life cycle for the production of software and applications </li><li>Modifying and testing changes to previously developed applications </li><li>Deliver high quality code in a fast and efficient manner </li><li>Must be fluent in all things PHP, MySQL, and Javascript </li><li>Develop front-end and back-end software using PHP/MySQL and HTML/Javascript/CSS with Vue.js or React.js </li><li>Identify and mitigate end-to-end security concerns </li><li>Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability </li><li>Mentoring other engineers </li><li>Work across the organization to foster a culture of architecture that allows for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6496<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we‚Äôd welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Software Engineer C#/.NET
description: We are hiring a software developer to focus on dqlite, our distributed SQLite database which uses our own Raft library for establishing consensus and replication. Dqlite is available as a pure C library or through a Go package that we also maintain, and we intend to provide bindings for Python and other languages.<br><br>You will design and implement enhancements to the libraft, dqlite and go-dqlite components which we consume in MicroK8s, LXD and other projects. Work includes development in those pieces of software as well as responding to issues and user inquiries.<br><br>This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern computing technologies. Canonical offers a fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development opportunities.<br><br>What you will do<br><ul><li>Design and implement features across dqlite</li><li>Debug and fix issues encountered by your users</li><li>Improve Jepsen tests, traditional HA database automated testing and stress tests</li><li>Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural review</li><li>Engage with the open source community and commercial partners<br><br></li></ul><strong>Valuable Skills And Experience<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with distributed systems (preferably with Raft)</li><li>Good C programming experience</li><li>Solid understanding of asynchronous programming and concurrency patterns a plus</li><li>Capacity to learn quickly about new systems and techniques</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree<br><br></li></ul>Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.<br><br>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<br><br>#Stack<br><br>

migration of application from legacy systems to new solutions.</li><li>Monitor the system performance by performing regular tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new features.</li><li>Recommend solutions to improve new and existing API solutions.</li><li>Educate staff members through training and individual support.</li><li>Offer support by responding to system problems in a timely manner.</li><li>Understand and document data flows in and between different systems/applications</li><li>Guidance to developers in preparing functional/technical specs to define developing requirement and process.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>
